1.content:
Another day of training with your Pokemon has come to an end. You wiped the moist sweat off your face and called your Vaporeon back to your side and patted her.

"Good work, Vaporeon! You sure did a great job today. Hope you keep up the good work. At the rate you're improving, I probably have to buy you some Pokeblocks soon."

Vaporeon gave you a satisfied cry and nuzzled you hand affectionately. You brought out her Pokeball and returned her before clipping it back onto your belt. The past few months had been relatively quiet, no disasters or any crazy organizations causing havoc.

It's a refreshing change for once! you thought.

Seeing the fine weather, you decided to take a walk in the forest before returning. The sun is nearing the horizon, casting the trees in a brilliant orange and pink. As you walked among the trees and bushes, you reminisced about the past. This was the same forest where you were shrunken by accident. Has it really been a year since I first met Lugia among these tall canopies? Time sure flies when you're happy.

Lugia and Floatzel are still in regular contact with you. Sometimes, you met in person for a little reliving of your shrunken state. Every time, both Pokemons fight over who should let the human explore their body first. But most of the time, you chose to stick with Lugia.

At other times, you spent hours talking with Lugia telepathically about your life and activities. From what you learned, both of Lugia and Floatzel returned to being teacher and protege, training and strengthening each other. Floatzel is progressing tremendously with his psychic power and from what Lugia said, he could soon become a mentor in his own right. The Sea Weasel Pokemon constantly boasted that he will soon be a Legendary that will unseat Lugia to rule the sea, much to the amusement of his teacher. You had many good laughs with the two Pokemons.

Due to your recent schedule, you and Lugia haven't been able to see each other more frequently. But your affection for her has not diminish. In fact, you felt ever more attached to Lugia. You took note that you probably should arrange another meeting with her once you have time. You can't wait to meet the beautiful Pokemon again.

Your thoughts led you to think of another Pokemon, one that is far less welcoming.

Ho-oh on the other hand, is something you want to relegate to the deepest, repressed and unreachable part of your brain. That so-called Legendary bird is a real piece of work. And you are glad that you haven't heard of him for an entire year since you rammed him into a cave wall. His disappearance hasn't gone by unnoticed. Trainers are abuzz with theories of what led to Ho-oh's sudden departure, with many lamenting that they won't have the chance of capturing the Pokemon. The priestess of the Burned Tower said that this is a bad omen of gargantuan proportion. Ho-oh's disappearance also surprised even the most seasoned Pokemon scientists into declaring it an unprecedented abnormality. The news are drumming up stories that this somehow means that the end is near.

In your opinion, it's all just nonsense and outright silliness. Those are just crazed theories cooked up by someone looking to scare others. Besides, those people haven't heard about the low regard that Pokemon has for humans. If they did, they'll be singing a different tune.

For now, you like to think that Ho-oh is probably somewhere wallowing in his own sadness after being owned and defeated by a human and Lugia. You especially took pleasure to imagine how pathetic he must felt right now.

You chortled at the mental image as you strolled to a particularly large tree in the deeper part of the forest. It's the tree you always went to when you wanted to clear your mind of life problems or battle losses. The wide branches and leaves provide the perfect shade while the roots act as your seat. You sat at the usual spot and looked at the orange twilight while wondering what you will do tomorrow. You noticed a shape in the distant sky flying toward you. The object is massive and glowing with power. You immediately thought that it might be Lugia but quickly reminded yourself that she is currently at Whirlpool Islands and didn't plan on visiting you until two weeks later. So who's that then?

The dark form of the creature got closer to you. You could make out the feathered tail and wings the glows bright orange in the subset. The leaves rustled around you as the gales grew intense from the fluttering wings of the Pokemon. You closed your eyes and covered your face with your clothes to shield yourself from the pebbles being kicked up. When the dusts settled a few seconds later, you slowly uncovered your face and opening your eyes. Your vision is still blurry from tears but you can make out a massive form in front of you. Orange feathers, talons, green crown...

"Hello again, human," a very familiar voice chimed.
1.title: Start

11.content:
You are blinked your eyes as the being came into sharp focus. It took your mind less than a second to register the identity of the voice. It belongs to none other than Ho-oh, the so-called Legendary Pokemon. The giant bird perched himself on a large log several yards away from you. There was the initial feeling of surprise upon seeing his immense form. But disgust quickly took over as memories of your detention came back to you. He was the last thing you ever wanted to see.

"What are you doing here?!" You growled.

"Meeting up with an old friend," Ho-oh said with a smirk.

"What the...?! Quite the nerves you have to show up again," you glared at the Pokemon, "Just scram, I don't want to see you again. Get out of my life!"

"My, is that the way you're supposed to talk to me? Such awful lack of manners, human. I hope you wouldn't hate the consequences. But you know perfectly well what I'm capable of."

"You always have to start things off with a threat, don't you Ho-oh? But, I'm no longer under your control and I don't care whatever you want to do to me. I was wishing that you've somehow banished yourself from existence."

"You never missed me over my one-year absence?" Ho-oh said with fake sadness.

"Never. I was hoping that you've been miserable for the last twelve months," you jabbed back in return.

"And that's exactly what happened," Ho-oh said, "You see, the mess you and Lugia caused while controlling me took me months to fix. When news about my humiliation at your hand became public, thanks to Lugia, I was forced to go into hiding from all the prying and critical eyes I get everywhere I go. I was accused by many of setting back Pokemon-human relations by hundreds of years. I told them that humans are nothing but a pain and oppressor of Legendaries. None would hear out my story of my miserable encounter with you. They said I 'lost it' after my first capture and abandonment by a trainer."

"They weren't that far off about that," you said, enjoying every moment of Ho-oh misery.

"Shut up, human!!!" Ho-oh screeched, "Worst of all, news of this mess somehow traveled all the way up to Lord Arceus and he is NOT happy about this."

"I assume you meant not happy about your actions. I won't be surprised if He decided to erase you from existence."

"No! He paid me a visit and lectured me for days. That nincompoop told me that he has suspended my legendary status indefinitely and strongly curtailed my powers. How can I show my face if I'm no longer considered a Legendary Pokemon? They'll laugh me out of Council. I've lost all credibility because of Lugia, and particularly, because of you!"

At this point Ho-oh became visibly upset and glared at you menacingly.

"Frankly, you deserved it," you replied unfazed.

"That's what they all say!" the Pokemon fired back, "Arceus told me to make up for my mistakes, you know those typical requirement where I 'learn to be friends with the human' and 'friendship blah blah blah' before giving my powers back to me. Not believing any of that. Not one bit."

"Then it looks like you are never getting your power and prestige back, Ho-oh," you said gleefully, "I hope you enjoy being an ordinary Pokemon for the rest of your life."

"Don't be a smartass, human! I have dealt with your kind for far more than you'll ever live. I came to you specifically to fix that. I've figured a workaround to my problem."

"Your problem? That's got nothing to do with me and I definitely do not want to be a part of your sorry drama."

At the moment, Ho-oh craned his head downward and reach eye level with you. The look he gave you could probably set you on fire if he wills it strongly enough.

"I'm in no mood at being insulted, human. So you could do well and listen to me."

The Pokemon used his beak to push you back into the tree trunk. Ho-oh lowered his head until he rests his head directly in front of you toward you and positioned his large eyes on you. Those brilliant vermillion irises reflected your frightened face as Ho-oh's beak curled into a frown.

"Now see for yourself the damage you've wrecked upon me."

The Pokemon's pupils dilated to unnaturally large size until the irises are thin rings. The dark, featureless pools flashed and began to beam images like a display. The first thing you see is a forum that was used by Ho-oh. The thread pasted by an anonymous Pokemon begins with the headline "Ho-oh Lost It!!! Human-hating Phoenix is Legendary No More!" Save for a few posts of sympathy, the responses were mostly nasty and sarcastic. Many "congratulated" the Pokemon for his demotion. Others recommend that he should get used to being treated like a common Pidgey. From the look of it, he isn't exactly popular right now.

"And it gets "better" ," Ho-oh seethed.

Ho-oh blinked his eyes to change the content. This time his pupils showed a network called "Psyfriends". You remembered that Lugia told you about this Pokenet site for psychic Pokemons to meet up. Ho-oh's profile page is defaced with crude pictures and messages written in all caps calling the Pokemon a human-hater. Some of the posts contained explicits pictures, the same ones you've encountered when you visited Ho-oh's brain. They were somehow leaked. To makes matter worst, he responded angrily and denied those belonged to him. The replies from his friends were caught between shock and disgust.

"Ho-oh Exposed! Legendary revealed to be a Pervert," someone said gleefully.

I can't believe you WERE a sicko. Goodbye Ho-oh!

I can't believe that you would do that. And what, we're friends for centuries? That's just low, buddy...

"How could you?! You never told me that you were going to use me in your weird fantasies. That's it, perv. Don't you ever talk to me again."

"Hey everybody! Let's all unfriend this bastard to oblivion!" one suggested.

You looked at Ho-oh's friend list at the side of the page. Sure enough his list of friends has gone from 130 down to just 1 in three hours. Only Lugia's name remained on the list and she was blocked.

Ho-oh blinked his eyes again and they now depict an art blog dedicated to Ho-oh in the worst imaginable way. The whole forum is filled with demeaning drawings depicting the Legendary Pokemon as a dark menacing being or as a klutzy-headed buffoon. Some of tge drawing are little more that poorly drawn stick figures. One that really takes the cake has Ho-oh as a crying chick in a playpen whining about how everyone hates him.

Ho-oh blinked his eyes again and brought them back to normal.

"Seeing these just makes my blood boil! I've become the laughingstock of the Pokenet and all my usual friends are avoiding me," Ho-oh stomped his talon.

"Well, it sucks to be you," you said with an eyeroll.

"No need to feel sorry for me, you human!" Ho-oh said as his voice hardened again, "You're coming with me to fix things up."

"No deal."

"Ah, yes! I was planning on making my body a little friendlier for you. No more slop for food or slimy rooms. For all of that, I just want you to get everything back in order."

"Live in that hellhole you call your body, forget it!"

"Too bad! You have no choices," Ho-oh said as he lunged at you and grabbed you with his beak, "I hope I'll be the better host this time."

Ho-oh threw you up in to the air and watched you plunged into his mouth, savoring your taste for a brief moment before swallowing.
11.title: Ho-oh

You decide to go towards the tail

111.content:
You couldn't believe what was happening. How in the world had everything gone from 'life is good' to 'once again being trapped by Ho-oh?' And how had he found you? Well it's possible he had heard that it had been in that forest where you and Lugia had met, where you had been shrunk a year ago. But of all days he had to go to that forest just when you were feeling nostalgic and wanted to walk around there.

What were the odds?

It was more likely that Ho-oh had kept watching over the forest somehow, waiting for you. That wasn't more comforting at all, in fact it was more unnerving.

When you hit Ho-oh's tongue you almost faint. Usually when you reentered Lugia or Floatzel's body through the mouth your contact with saliva was minimal, but this time you had fell face-first onto the tongue, practically getting soaked. The tongue moved backwards, bringing you towards the throat. You barely had time to react before you were unceremoniously thrown back into a place you were sure you would never visit again.

The journey down Ho-oh's long neck was quick, depositing you in an organ that wasn't familiar to you, filled with rocks and other similar indigestible material. However before you had any time to even stand up you were pushed down another path, which led to one place that you did remember, and not because you had loved it, the gizzard. The avian stomach was just like you remembered, spacious and definitely not very welcoming. To make everything even worse, unlike the last time you were there, where the content of the gizzard was limited to puddles of acids and nothing else, it now was half-full of soggy herbs and plants. "Oh great, just great. Did you do this on purpose?"

"Do what?" Ho-oh replied curtly. You could notice the annoyance in his voice and you were not surprised to notice you didn't care the least about that.

"Why did you have to trap me shortly after you had lunch?"

"You were the one who went to the forest at this time. It's not my fault!"

"You had said you would be a better host!" Not that he could be worse...or that I plan to stay for long.

"It was an accident, okay? I do intend to be a better host in some ways, but I also haven't forgotten all the suffering you and Lugia made me go through. I have the right to be petty at times"

You facepalmed, groaning, and stood up. You climbed the plants around you, being careful to not to fall in any liquids that were gathering on the floor of the gizzard. It was just as disgusting as you expected, and in that moment you felt very grateful to Lugia and Floatzel for keeping their stomachs empty when you were inside them. "I haven't agreed I'll help you. You weren't exactly a gracious host and I haven't forgotten that"

There was silence for a moment while you finally got to the highest point. Finally Ho-oh talked, apparently having calmed down a bit. It seemed he was doing an huge effort trying to be civil. "We're not going to get anywhere if we keep focusing on what we did to each other. You did wrong to me and I suppose it could be possible I may have given you just a little bit of bad treatment before. But I'm desperate. Do you think if I weren't desperate you'd be alive in this moment?"

He had a point there. You imagined that if you ever met again he'd incinerate you at the first chance, not lock you again in his body...with supposedly better conditions. Ho-oh continued speaking. "I really need my Legendary status back. I have lived with it too long to simply go back to being a common Pokémon. You caused this and so you're the only one who can solve this. Lugia won't even talk to me for obvious reasons.

I'm actually ordering...begging you here: help me"

You gritted your teeth. While you were kind of grateful he had some mercy on letting you live...your actual situation definitely wasn't going to be what you would have chosen if he had asked, although you doubted you'd ever have listened what he had to say. Besides you were once again locked inside him. Escaping? He surely learned from last time. No more trips to his brain. That was very likely to not to be an option anymore.

There were several entrances and exits to the body, but surely Ho-oh already took measures to block them, although knowing him there was a chance the only one he left was the most humiliating and least desirable one, which would be his cloaca, just to see you escape and trap you instantly. You weren't going to give him the satisfaction of such a moment.

All in all, accepting your situation seemed...the only thing to do. You hated yourself a little for what you were going to say. "Okay, I'll stay here, but there are some conditions I need to lay. Without them I won't do anything to help you"

Ho-oh grumbled under his breath before replying. "Okay, okay. What conditions are those?"

"First: no pressuring me. I have no idea yet how to do such thing, so I need time to think. I don't know how long it'll take, either, so just leave this to me" That should give me some time to think of a way to stop all this.

"Fine"

"I also want to be treated with dignity. No pushing me to places I don't want to go. No impromptu journeys to your bowels, no going around cleaning, no giving you forced pleasure, nothing like that. If I ever go to any place it'll be on my own will" Not that I plan to go hang around his intestines or his privates again. I already had enough of that.

"That was obvious, human. I said I'd be a better host"

"Third. Uh..." you couldn't really think of a third. You considered making him give you a way to keep in contact with Lugia or Floatzel, but he wasn't an idiot. There was no way he was going to accept that. Besides, he didn't know you were supposed to meet Lugia in two weeks. If you resisted two weeks inside him then maybe things would get solved by then.

"Can't think of a third, ah?"

"Third, I want to be free to walk around your body" you decided.

"I won't allow you to access my brain if that's what you're insinuating" Ho-oh's tone had gotten harsher.

"That wasn't what I meant. Keep that out of limits, I suppose, but I want to be able to go anywhere else"

"Fine. You can go anywhere in my body except my brain. Anything else?"

"I think that's all for now. Where will I sleep?" you looked around the gizzard. That better not be your new bedroom.

"As a sign of good will I'll allow you to choose the location if your bedroom anywhere in my body. You should remember a few places in it, but in case you don't know here are some indications from my gizzard.

You'll find four openings. One goes into my intestines, one goes into my back and towards my back and tail feathers and all organs through that path, one goes towards my chest and all organs in that location and the last one goes towards my foundry. This last one is not a good option, you wouldn't be able to endure the heat for hours"

"Okay, but which one leads where?"

"That's for you to find out" Ho-oh cawed and refused to say anything else.

Sighing, you looked around the gizzard, locating the four options. You pinpointed where the sphincter you had come through was and deduced the opening directly opposite to that one led to the bowels, so that option was crossed out.

The way towards the chest was high in the walls, you'd need to go and climb more of Ho-oh's lunch to reach it. The one that went to his back and to the end of his tail was the one closest to you. The one for the foundry must have been the last one, so you ignored it.

After a moment of trying to remember the location of the organs you had seen last time (you noticed that you couldn't even guess where in Ho-oh's body most of them were located), you made your decision.
111.title: Into the Bird once more

1111.content:
You chose the passage that you assumed will take you to Ho-oh's chest. It is near the top of the gizzard and is almost vertical in position. For this simple reason, it's impossible for you to reach that opening without first climbing through the green mush that is Ho-oh's lunch and dirtying yourself in the process. You believed that Ho-oh made the better choices hard to reach as his method of screwing with you. It's his way of telling you to 'give up and just live in the tail end where I can toy with you all I want'. You aren't gonna let that happen and allow Ho-oh to have his merry way. If he intends to test you, then you're gonna returning the favor by besting all the challenges.

As always, to establish a goal is one thing but to actually put your plan into action, it requires far more effort. Especially true when you are nauseous at the sight of half-digested plants and herbs piled several stories high around you. The movements within the gizzard made the whole mountain look alive, even menacing. It brought back awful memories of the unmentionable food you were force fed last time and you intend to avoid anything that's remotely related to mush.

"Hey, made up your mind yet, human? Your friendly host Ho-oh is getting a little impatient here," the Pokemon chimed.

"Yeah, but I'm trying to figure out how to navigate past all this pile of junk," you replied back.

"Better make it quick then. You don't want me to change my mind and let you sleep in my gizzard," Ho-oh laughed smugly.

"Doesn't matter to me anyways. It seems to me that your body was designed to make my life as miserable as possible."

"I'll make it better!" Ho-oh replied impatiently, "Just give me time, alright?"

"I'm very doubtful about that."

"What is there to doubt about, human?" Ho-oh asked inquisitively.

"Well, let's see. First, you did yourself a very bad first impression by snatching me from Lugia and rambled about your hatred for humankind nonstop. Then you decide to use me as your personal servant to clean your bowels and gizzard as a way to validate those twisted beliefs, punishing me with electrical shocks should I disobey. And let's not forget the pleasure game."

"...Look human, I went a bit overboard with your treatment, alright?" the Pokemon relented, "My past experience with humans got the best of me. I promise you, there will be no more force-feeding or unreasonable questionnaires. I believe this is a perfect chance for us to start a new page. Wouldn't you agree, human?"

"Overboard? I think the better term would be nefarious. I find it rather difficult to believe that you're being honest here. And you've made no guarantee that you won't return to your arrogant and snarky ways once I helped get your Legendary status reinstated. What exactly do I have to gain from helping you if you're essentially unchanged?"

Ho-oh remained silent for a while to let your words sink in. It's a surprise that he hasn't figured out a smartass reply like he usually do. You heard him giving a frustrated sigh before speaking again.

"Listen here, human," Ho-oh said through clenched teeth, "You seriously need to stop being so distrustful. I'm trying my best to be nice here and that's some awfully hard work for someone who hated your guts not so long ago. Now, I believe that you and I can agree to one thing: we're in a situation we don't like. So let's face the matter we have at hand, shall we?"

"Not until you made it worth my time."

"Remember this, I can be nice but if you step out of line, don't blame me when you find yourself under my old wrathful side. Deal?"

"For the time being, yes."

"Good, I'll talk with you later when you reached your destination."

With that Ho-oh snorted and went on about his business, leaving you to make your next move. The Pokemon spread his multicolored wings and took off toward the sky at breakneck speed.

You gulped internally as you felt a slight lurch and the familiar feeling of lightness. There's no going back on this one. Ho-oh talking with some semblance of rationality isn't something you're used to yet. You could tell that he is holding back his tongue and hastily attempt to show that he's friendly. You'll give the Pokemon credit for that.

No use sitting here. Better get moving.

Climbing Ho-oh's meal wasn't bad if you are able to disregard crawling on all four up a mushy heap of leaves and flowers that's starting to ferment in the heat. You are less than a third way up and your shirt and pants are already covered in green juice and smelled of rotting hay. Your favorite shoes are in no better state. It took several falls and yelps before you reached the sphincter you want to use. You could hear Ho-oh snickering about you're predicament as he glided idly through the clouds.

You mentally reminded yourself that you're asking Ho-oh to pay you for ruining your clothing.

After forcing it open, a rush of cool air blew past you, sending a shiver down your moist back. The tunnel above is little more than a shaft with rungs embedded in its fleshy walls. Climbing the steps is an arduous task and the churning and the groaning flesh all added a disconcerting feeling to this already narrow passage to a supposedly better location in the chest. Ho-oh's heartbeat is strong enough is send a powerful vibration through the entire shaft.

One exhausting and uncertain ascent later, you reached another sphincter which promptly opened and invited you in. You entered a small cavity about the size of a living room that is supported by several ivory-colored ribs. The entire floor is covered with soft translucent bumps that made it look like bubble wrappers. The see-through nature of the floor allows you to view Ho-oh's giant heart and his equally impressive pair of lungs doing their work to support this impressive Pokemon.

"Welcome to the all-new chest chamber," Ho-oh said, "I hope you'll find it more welcoming than my stomach, human."

After enjoying the view of the vital organs, you turned your attention to the chamber's other features. On one side is a raised rectangular mound covered with green and orange feathers. Upon closer look, there is a pouch-like depression large enough to fit you snugly. You sat on it and felt the softness and warmth. It's a big upgrade from the damp stomach you were accommodated at last time.

A simple desk and chair set made of iron sit right next to the bed. On the desk was a familiar and unsettling piece of equipment: the locator watch. That strap was used by Ho-oh to deliver electric shocks and to track your location in his body. The mere sight of the device upsets you.

"Hey! I thought you promised that there's no coercing," you said angrily.

"Who told you I'm giving you the same thing?" Ho-oh asked amusedly, "I removed the shocker and added more helpful functions."

"And what are they?"

"The locator can still allow me to see your location. But you now have a 'privacy switch' that allows you to turn it off at anytime you want. Be aware that visits to unauthorized places can still be detected."

"Okay, that addresses one concern."

"In return for staying with me, you'll receive an allowance of 50 tokens each week that can be spent on all sorts of amenities I can provide. Additional tokens can be earned by helping out around my body or improving my reputation. When you save enough, you have the opportunity to upgrade your room more to your liking."

"Sounds acceptable at least. And what does this yellow button on the side do? I don't remember seeing that before?"

"That is a new feature of the locator that you'll love. Remember the shocker function I removed from your locator? It is now installed in various parts in my body. That button activates those shockers. You can now use it to discipline me should I start being rude to you or other Pokemons. It'll remind me when I'm misbehaving. Heck, you can even shock me for little trivial things like I do. What I did to you was unjustified and it's only fair that I endure the same."

"That's one feature I'll definitely use!" You grinned as you strapped the locator to your wrist.

"Any places you would like to go to, human?"
1111.title: You decide to go towards the chest

11111.content:
Idly touching the yellow button that would let him shock Ho-oh and barely restraining yourself you thought about your options. It was starting to be late, you may as well try to get comfortable. You had a bedroom, that was good, although the heartbeat could potentially be a bother during nighttime. Now what other necessity did you have and you wanted to see solved now...?

Food.

You wanted to be sure you weren't going to be fed sludge like last time. It was a tad late for lunch and a bit early for dinner but you didn't mind. Peace of mind was good at any point of the day. "If you don't mind I'd like to eat something" you stated "Where do I need to go for that?"

"So soon?"

"Yeah, is there a problem with that? I could try later" you tried your best to not to sound defiant. The last thing you wanted was to make your host angry just before eating. Who knew what he would do to your food if you did.

"I'll find something. I didn't think you'd want to eat so soon..." he grumbled but seemed to accept your request "Follow that path, it isn't too far from your room" the room seemed to tilt, making you look in the opposite direction from where you had entered.

"Would I be right if I think you're vegetarian?" With some luck the answer was yes and he would be bothered by having to find you some meat.

"Not at all. I can get you some meat" On the other hand that was good. If he wasn't picky about that then you could get something good "I won't give you some right now, if that's what you're implying" his voice hardened.

"No, it was just curiosity" making sure the locator machine would stay in your wrist you walked towards that direction, arriving to a rather small room in just a couple minutes. It was almost empty, only having a ledge where you supposed you could sit. It was a relief to see it was different to the place where a year ago Ho-oh force-feed you, maybe he was serious about the whole 'being friendlier', even if it wasn't much.

After all how soon can somebody like Ho-oh change and really be at least kind to you?

"Sit there" your host instructed "It won't take long" you obeyed, waiting patiently. In a few seconds a heap of strands of herbs fell from the ceiling. You could recognize some of them mainly because you just had seen them in the process of fermenting. That didn't help your appetite at all.

"Um"

"What?"

"Are these even edible for me?"

"How do you expect me to know?" he groused "Try them and see, that's all there's for now"

Hoping that your next meals are better than this one you grabbed a handful and chewed them a bit. Just as you expected it was a strange experience and not exactly pleasant. They tasted bland and were definitely not suitable for you. But the fact you were given that was at least calming. You weren't going to receive any nasty stuff when you asked for food. Trusting Ho-oh just a tiny bit more you continued chewing until you were sure you weren't going to fall down with severe stomach cramps. "Thank you" you said.

"Anything else you want to see?"

"Seeing these herbs remind me way too much of the welcome I had" you stated, leaving them on the ledge and hoping Ho-oh wouldn't notice you hadn't eaten much "I want to take a bath. Where can I do that?"

"Do you really think I have lots of water just for you to have baths whenever you want?"

"No, but it's urgent" Your hands and arms were starting to itch. Maybe some of those plants weren't something you should be touching your bare skin.

"Fine, fine! I'll show you!" A new path opened to the side of the place you were in right now. It was just a bit bigger than you and you had the hunch Ho-oh had made it that way to bother you, as a petty revenge for making him prepare that. Soon you arrived in a round room with a big pool of water in the center. You're liking the fact that the water was clean but the temperature was a bit on the lukewarm side. But you're going to have to make this work; Ho-oh wouldn't like a chooser. You started undressing, but while you were doing it you found something round you had forgotten you had.

A Pokeball.

"It can't be..." You had forgotten about Vaporeon. She had been with you in the forest shortly before Ho-oh found you and she had gone into her Pokéball...she was trapped with you. "Oh, damn" Telling Ho-oh was something to do now. At least, you had that new function of the locator if Ho-oh got funny ideas or tried to get Vaporeon outside. But first...you had to make sure Vaporeon understood the situation.

Sure, she had been inside Lugia, but that was different. Lugia was a friendly host, Ho-oh was not...very much. Even their bodies were different! Vaporeon needed to know what was going on. Then after that you'd tell Ho-oh that a new guest was inadvertently brought inside him all along.

Trying to order your thoughts you threw the Pokéball inside the pool, seeing it release your friend.
11111.title: Some place to eat

111111.content:
Your Pokeball landed on the surface of the pool and popped open with a dazzling display of blue light. At first, only faint silhouette emerged from the contraption but it gradually grew in size. Basic features such as the face and tail became apparent as the Pokemon slowly reconstruct herself from the water. No matter how many times you see it, you are still amazed at the process of how Vaporeon can merge with surrounding water without ever giving away her presence. Perfectly invisible. When it comes to surprise, nothing beats hiding in a tub and waiting for the perfect moment to give you a faceful of Water Gun. It happened so many times that you consider her the assertive one whenever you two are around a swimming pool or river. It's no wonder that bath time is her favorite part of the day.

When her reformation is completed, Vaporeon shrilled and leapt out out of the pool to give you a playful nuzzle. You patted her head, eliciting a satisfied coo as the Pokemon wrapped her fish-like tail around your leg.

"Hi. Vaporeon. How are we doing?" you said cheerfully, "Didn't expect me to drop you directly in the pool, did you?"

The Pokemon tilted her head and eyed you inquisitively.

"Of course. I was just trying different ways to keep you entertained."

Vaporeon looked at you with an amused expression.

"Say, I was thinking that we both can really use a bath right now. Wanna join me?"

Vaporeon removed herself from you and started shrilling happily. The word 'bath' is the trigger word that would make her forget all her worries. With her excitement hardly contained, Vaporeon bounced in circles in front of you.

"Alright then. You go first, as always," you said as you removed your underwear and socks threw them aside.

Vaporeon curiously examined the water by touching it with one of her paws. Sensing that nothing is unusual, she pounced in without second thoughts.

Both you and Vaporeon went into the pool without any delays. You settled down near the middle where the water is deep enough to cover your neck. Your favorite companion returned to her water form and playfully swam around your body. The tickling sensation of her paws and tail brushing you made you squirm. And her Water Jet knows where exactly to strike for maximum effect. You swirled your finger in the pool and allowed the half-dissolved Vaporeon to chase and gently nip at it.

"Hahaha...you sure are lively today," you chuckled.

She gave you a happy cry in return.

"This is just perfect," you said softly, " Never thought Ho-oh could provide something resembling hospitality."

Vaporeon's ears perked up at some gurgling sound and she studied her surroundings carefully. It is the first time she noticed the organic looking walls and ceiling. She realized that this isn't the lodge or swimming pool she's used to. The Pokemon turned her blue eyes on you, longing for an explanation.

"You're probably wondering what the heck is this place. Long story short, I got recaptured by an old acquaintance," you said and glare at the ceiling.

The Pokemon followed your eyes for a few seconds but returned her gaze toward you.

"That look can only mean one thing: you want to hear more, right?Are you sure you wanna hear the long version?"

Vaporeon nodded.

"You're always one for stories," you said with a weak smile, "Curl up and hear me then."

You told her about your first encounter with the legendary Ho-oh and all the nefarious acts he committed. You chronicled your escape, subsequent adventures, and eventual return to normal life. A year later, you were taking a stroll and Ho-oh suddenly came to recapture you. You explained that Ho-oh promised that he will try to be a better host and wanted you to help him get his Legendary status restored.

Although Vaporeon merely listened to your one-sided talk with her, she seemed to get the gist and general feeling you're conveying. For you, it is nice to speak with someone you know is on your side although you never expected a response from her.

Your story continued for another half hour or so, explaining to Vaporeon how you'll likely proceed with Ho-oh and the kinds of plans you have for him in the future. By the time you finished your story, Vaporeon looked drowsy and gave an audible yawn.

"I guess that's it for today. Come. let me get you in a bed."

You got up from the pool and carried Vaporeon back to the chest chamber and settled her on the top of the desk. You'll have to tell your host about her soon. The feathered bed looks very welcoming as you are feeling sleepy too. But you realized that you are missing your clothes. The old ones are no good to you.

"Hey Ho-oh, I'm done with my bath. I'm planning on hitting the hay soon."

"Okay, are you happy now?" Ho-oh said testily, "You used up a quarter of my water for that long bath. Those water could have lasted three days. I hope you're thinking about what to do for me in return."

"I'll have to think about that since you only performed the tasks half-heartedly and begrudgingly."

"You should be thankful that I even have you in there."

"Whatever you say. By the way, you got anything I could wear?"

"Got nothing like that. Do I look like I got stores throughout my body? I'm structured more differently than Lugia," Ho-oh said irritatingly, "Why would you need clothes anyway?"

"Well, for starters, Pokemons like you either have feathers or fur to keep themselves warm in cold climates and have no exact concept of modesty. But I'm human and it's just unnatural to be clothless."

"Hey! There's no one in here to see you naked except me," Ho-oh said teasingly, "No need to be shy here."

"Would you like me to try out that little yellow button, you pervert?" you said firmly, "I need really some clothes and fast."

".....Fine! Just let me get it ready by morning. You are such a killjoy to me. Now just sleep, will you? We've got a long day ahead and I got some more flying to do before I rest too," Ho-oh said impatiently.

"Good night, Ho-oh" you said, trying to sound polite again.

"Sleep tight, human. And don't let my body have fun with you at night," Ho-oh said cockily.

You quickly lay down on the bed, making sure that Vaporeon is also good, and made yourself comfortable before snoozing off in a few minutes.
111111.title: One-sided Conversation with Vaporeon

choices: Look for ways to bond with Ho-oh
1111111.content:
When you awoke you were amazed you fell asleep in the first place.

You weren't sure how long it had been until you looked at your locator. Much to your surprise you had slept seven hours despite the disturbances in the chest chamber, it was 3 AM. The heart below the transparent floor resounded in your bedroom, almost as if it were directly inside your head. Groaning you stood up, looking down.

It was almost hypnotic to watch it, but you had better things to do than stare at your host's heart, even if its slow rhythm was kind of relaxing when you focused on it. It was going to officially be the first full day inside Ho-oh and you had some serious thinking to do.

Vaporeon was happily asleep over the desk and you didn't want to wake her up unnecessarily. As long as she didn't get out of your bedroom everything should be fine. You had a concrete place to go, as you craved anything that could confirm without any doubt what Ho-oh had been saying about being a better host.

It took you quite a while to find a path to the head and to your objective. In your other stay you didn't really explore the winding paths that weren't organs or anything else, so most of the body was unknown at least in that regard. The path was tiring and you were glad you at least slept deeply, even if it was still way too early. You blamed the sound of Ho-oh's breathing and heartbeat and considered asking him to let you move, but you suspected a hefty amount of tokens would be needed.

Soon after around half an hour of ascending nonstop you walked forward until you got to the place you were hoping to reach. A few steps along the edge of the throat until you stepped on the tongue. You officially were inside Ho-oh's beak.

You were relieved to see that it was slightly open, way more than enough for you to go through.

You walked over the length of the tongue, always staring at the way out, until you were almost on the tip. There you sat down, thoughtful. Did this mean Ho-oh wanted to be a better host? He had knowingly left an easy way out. Sure, you wouldn't really be able to do a lot in your actual size and Ho-oh was the only one who could return you to your size, but compared to last time this is as if he left an huge hole on the wall of a fortress.

If he's really willing to do this then...I suppose I could give him a chance. At least he's more reasonable now. But what could convince Arceus? I doubt a mere 'hey we're friends now' would be enough for hi to give back the legendary status to this stupid bird.

The tongue under you shifted, making you think Ho-oh was awake now, but nothing else happened. You continued sitting, trying to think. Yesterday you had shared Vaporeon possible plans for the future inside Ho-oh, but it wasn't anything you were completely sure would happen.

First things first: we have to truly trust each other, but how can I do that? You had never owned any avian Pokémon, so you had no idea how to bond with one, and even if you did it was likely anything you could do wouldn't work from the inside. Unless...

You remembered a not so good moment from a year ago. You had been forced groom Ho-oh and it had been a bad experience, as expected from anything that would involve the bird. If it's ever needed I at least could interact with a projection of him. That didn't change the fact you had no idea how to proceed, though.

"Are you trying to escape, human?"

You were startled, snapping out of your thoughts. "No, no, no, no! I was just here, thinking..."

"You could have done that in your room" he groused.

"I have been here for quite a while. I could have escaped anytime but I didn't" Ho-oh didn't reply at that. Instead something ringed in your locator, prompting you to look. Once you did you saw a number. "Twenty?"

"That's your weekly allowance" he explained "Since your very inconsiderate use of my resources I decided to charge you for your daily necessities. You can also see in your locator a list of the prices"

You did so, frowning. With twenty tokens you didn't have enough for three daily meals, a bath and anything else you needed. You'd be short for a couple days. "I wouldn't have asked for a bath if it weren't for your very inconsiderate welcome, you know"

"It wasn't my fault!"

You pressed the yellow button, sending a shock on wherever Ho-oh was ready to be punished. Ho-oh suddenly stood up, making you fall face first onto the tongue. "Okay, it was, it was!"

"Good to see we understand each other, but these tokens won't be enough for the week"

"I already told you yesterday that by doing jobs inside me you would obtain more, and I'm very generous with them. A single one would give you enough for the week, while the hardest one would last you at least two months. You could check that in the Work Center"

"How nice. Either way, I have been thinking about what we have to do and...yeah, I'm cooperating. I think I know what to do"

"Tell me"

"First we need to actually...like each other, even if it is enough for you to not to rip my head off at the first chance"

"And how do you plan to do such a feat?" he said, almost amused. You scowled

"Hell if I know"

Ho-oh didn't really like that answer "Then go think about that!" The tongue under you moved, bringing you to the throat again. Just before you got swallowed again you made your decision on what to do.
1111111.title: Night in the Bird

11111111.content:
Traveling down the esophagus and getting transported back down into the gizzard is the last thing you'd want to relive anytime soon but your host, Ho-oh, thinks otherwise. You fell and landed back into the gizzard with a thud. Thankfully, the place has been emptied of the disgusting mixture of herbs, leaving behind a quite spacious chamber. At least he's being a bit more thoughtful this time, you thought.

"Alright, human. You have two simple choices. Here's the deal. Either you try whatever unhelpful method you might have to bond with me or you start making yourself useful. So what would it be?"

You considered the choices presented by Ho-oh and decided that bonding with the Pokemon could wait. Finding something to like about Ho-oh is near impossible and with mutual distrust still running deep, it's unlikely in the near term. The more urgent thing is to earn tokens if you want to survive in here. You stood up and focused your voice at the ceiling.

"Okay. Please guide me to the Work Center. I want to earn some tokens."

"Just take the last tunnel to your left, human. Further instructions will be given once you're at the center," Ho-oh said nonchalantly.

You did as he instructed and entered the tunnel which takes you on a relatively slope-free route to your new destination. In the middle of your travel, you noticed that your locator started beeping; it sounded a bit different from the notification for added tokens. You lifted your hand and saw the screen on your wrist is showing a transaction of 8 tokens along with a short message.

"New clothing you ordered will cost you 8 tkns. Thank you >:P"

You're irritated by the taunting message and the fact that you've got only 12 tokens left. If you recall correctly, that amount will only get you a simple dish of raw plants and some berry juice with only a few tokens left for a 1-minute shower. You hated the idea of how Ho-oh still seems to relish on your misfortune despite his reassurance.

"Hey! What's the big idea? I'm already short on tokens and you're still charging me for those clothes?" you said annoyingly.

"Those clothes cost me time and effort to make; it's hard work for me," the Pokemon said complacently, "As I said before, I have limited resources in my body. You should be thankful that I'm even sharing them. A few tokens of appreciation isn't too much to ask, is it?"

"Yes it is! You're deliberately making it difficult for me, Ho-oh. And why should I play along with your game?" you said bluntly, "My old clothes got trashed and it's entirely your fault. Aren't you supposed to act more responsible after that "reminder" I gave you?"

"I am being responsible!" the Pokemon defended, "I made good on my promise to accommodate you. I provided you with a room, food, and a bathing chamber. Plus, I'm on my best possible behavior. And I got no rewards for that. Yet you're still complaining?"

Ho-oh's immature attempt to change the subject of the conversation only irks you further.

"That's not the problem, Ho-oh," you said as you attempt to control yourself, "I'm not a tightwad by any means but that charge is plain unacceptable given the cirsumstances. I simply want you to return the 8 tokens you took from me."

"Not going to happen. I told you that I will start charging for everything and I intend to follow through on that," Ho-oh replied, "Quit whining and shut up."

You promptly pressed the shocker on your locator several times, causing Ho-oh to cringe and howl in pain while in midair.

"Ow...ow....owwww...Making it stop! Make it stop!!! My wings...they're growing numb. Gosh, you're giving me cramps. Please, I'll listen to you...I get it! Please stop shocking me..."

"It looks like your so-called improvements are still highly unsatisfactory. Now, are you gonna refund me?" you grinned before you stopped shocking.

"Fine. I'll remove the clothing charge this time," the Pokemon relented and returned 8 tokens to your locator. You heard another beep from the device to confirm the transaction.

"Thank you. Isn't it much better if you just listen to me for once? I'm wondering why you always seems to get yourself in trouble, especially with that loud beak you have."

"More like trouble keeps getting in my way, human. I'm really starting to regret that I even willingly installed these shockers over my body," Ho-oh groaned, "I'm the idiot for giving you so much power. Wait a minute, maybe I should also charge you for every shock you give me. Sounds fair?"

"I'm more than willing to pay to see you getting fried. I believe that you need someone to discipline you and set you straight; someone who will establish the rules for you to behave. And I find myself unfortunate enough to be in that role as your sitter."

"Hmph! I'm not a young hatchling anymore! I don't need you to tell me what I can or cannot do," the bird scowled.

"Yet, you're acting like a petulant kid with a tantrum problem," You added rhetorically, "You wouldn't be in this position had you made a better first impression. How you managed to be promoted to a Legendary Pokemon is beyond me."

"Alright! Enough chitchat, human. Just get to the Work Center!" Ho-oh huffed.

You ignored Ho-oh's frustrated grunt and continued down the path. It took little effort for you to reach your intended destination.

Eventually, you see a doorway marked 'Work Center' at the end of the tunnel. You ushered yourself through a steel door and took in the sight. The room is about the same size as the chest chamber and resembles an amalgamation of a classroom and conference room. The floor is separated into terraced form, similar to a theater. If it weren't for the fact that the walls are literally flesh, you would assume that you had stumbled into some hidden lair. Schematic maps of Ho-oh's body are mounted on the walls of the Center. Each one of them has labels and captions explaining their purposes. The centerpieces of the room are a large screen which occupies an entire wall and an impressive-looking workstation in front of you. The workstation consists of even more displays that shows various measurements and statuses about the Pokemon's body. You sat in the single steel chair provided for you which caused the large screen blinked to life:

"Welcome to the Work Management System!
Please tap your locator on the sensor on the workstation to begin."

You did as instructed and the screen refreshes automatically.

Before you start your work for me, I believe that an orientation would be appropriate. We'll go over important things like rules, my various body parts, your responsibility, rewards, and of course, your compensation and the penalties for noncompliance. Please tap again and we're off to a good start :)


The cheerful instruction offered little explanation of what your duties would include. Penalties? Rewards? You're not liking the sound of those terms. You heaved a sigh and prepared yourself for whatever Ho-oh is going to throw at you.
11111111.title: Go to the Work Center

111111111.content:
The prospect of having to work in order to have a relatively dignified stay inside Ho-oh is something you really hate. You were considering telling Ho-oh about what you could do, which wasn't much right now, but his words made you decide to do it later. You had to think something effective for him to accept to cooperate.

You hoped you'd think of something quick before you have to do a lot of work for your host.

"Before starting I want you to promise I'm not going to be forced to do anything I don't want to do" you demanded firmly. Ho-oh was silent for a moment before saying calmly:

"You won't. You'll only do what you want to do, but remember your rewards are equivalent to your effort"

That was good enough for you. At least you weren't threatened with something like not having a room for the night if you didn't work. Besides it could be good to keep yourself busy while you tried to think a way.

Preparing yourself for the worst you tapped the sensor. The screen instantly turned bright, and a voice sounded, which you recognized as Ho-oh. You wondered for how long he had this recording in him. Maybe since before he found you? While the recording spoke several images filled the screen, providing helpful additions.

"You have been recruited as a worker inside my body. It may not be the best perspective but there has been several changes since your last time. As now you're a willing worker..." you took a moment to scoff at that "...you're going to be informed of several things.

There are only two rules: you'll finish your task before twenty four hours. You're allowed to stop and continue later, but if your job isn't finished you'll pay a penalty. The second rule is that you're going to do your job diligently and with care. You're being trusted with the maintenance of my body"

It was reasonable enough, in your opinion. Once those two rules were explained Ho-oh's recording started a long and frankly tedious explanation of his different organs. It was nothing you didn't know already. There were a few you had already visited a year ago, and the rest were organs and systems most living organisms have. You started tuning out, your thoughts wandering to focusing on quick ways to get Ho-oh to let you go.

"...for all tasks you accept you'll receive objects and equipment to make the task as easy as possible" you smiled in relief. That was something you were very grateful for. "Many tasks also include rewards which are added to your payment once the task is finished. These rewards can be from new furniture for your bedroom to access to communication to the outside world. Of course these rewards are limited to the most strenuous tasks in existence" Your smile was gone. It was to be expected, Ho-oh would never give you something that could make it easier to escape without having to do anything.

"The payment for each task is equivalent to the effort and time needed. The most menial task is guaranteed to cover your basic necessities for two days, while the highest paid one will allow you to live comfortably for a month" I'm not going to be here a month, right?

The recording continued onto the last part. "Penalties range from a reduced payment to the downgrading of your bedroom. As promised you won't be forced to experiment any nasty environments against your will but if you incur in penalties at some point you could even find yourself with not even a bed in your bedroom"

That was the end. Overall nothing the recording said was anything new or useful. Ho-oh may as well have said 'WORK AND GET PAID' and that would have been all you needed.

The screen showed what resembled a desktop with several applications, one of them apparently to see what tasks there were available. You opened it and found a dozen of options. You hovered over the task, a little map on the corner of the screen shining with the area or organ it involved. "That was neat and all that, Ho-oh, but are you sure you'll make this at least bearable?"

"I don't want any problems with you, human" Ho-oh said "Just work if you wish but remember you'll have to endure hardships if you wish to live with enough accommodations"

You continued hovering over the tasks until you got to one in middle of the list that got your attention. The map on the corner showed Ho-oh's silhouette glowing, the whole body involved. "Groom Ho-oh" That was short and to the point, but it have you an idea.

Legendary, former Legendary or not Ho-oh was still a Pokémon. You had raised and trained a team, six Pokémon loyal to you and to full strength. Vaporeon, currently in your bedroom or at least you hoped that, was proof of what you could achieve.

How else to achieve a bond with Ho-oh but caring for him as if he were your own Pokémon? Feeding him, keeping him clean, getting him to be stronger, doing everything in your power to ensure he knew he could trust you.

It's a simple plan and with some luck Vaporeon can help me with this. A Pokémon trained by me helping a new member of the team...it has logic. You had to tell Vaporeon about the plan. While she couldn't speak your language you were sure you'd understand any ideas she could have.

"Ho-oh, I'm going to do something for you today" you said "How much is this task worth?" You touched the task, highlighting it.

"It's worth 300 tokens. You could live well enough for a week" the bird informed and added with some mockery in his voice "I never thought you'd think of doing it again. To me it didn't seem like you had fun a year ago. Are you sure you want to?"

You cringed "Yeah. It'll be good help, won't it?"

"What do you mean?"

"I promise I'm going to have a change of attitude this time. We must turn f-f-friends..." it was something so ridiculous you couldn't say it in one try "...and the best way for that is to show I'm willing to do it, right? I'm going to take care of you"

Once again there was silence for a moment until Ho-oh finally replied. "I see...I don't know what to say but I'll accept it. Thank you human...for that" His tone was strange, like he didn't know how that made him feel. In a sense that was encouraging.

To you it was proof he was willing to accept what you intended to do. Maybe while you were doing that you could take the chance to talk with him.
111111111.title: Ho-oh's Orientation

1111111111.content:
Ho-oh's hesitation was a rather unexpected thing. Normally, he would have already been barking orders at you and making hard to fulfill demands about how to clean him. Equally surprising is the 'thank you' that came out of his mouth. It's the first time he expressed anything resembling gratitude toward you. Why did Ho-oh sounded slightly concerned when you volunteered to groom him? Does this means the former Legendary really intends to become better, albeit in his own mocking and sarcastic way?

"Well, I better get started then, Ho-oh," you said, "But before I start, could you hold on for a while please? I gotta head back to the bedroom to get some things. I have to prepare for this occasion."

"That's fine with me. But make it quick," Ho-oh ordered, "As you already aware, I'm not one who is used to waiting!"

"I won't keep you hanging for too long. I promise," you assured him.

"Hmm...Alright, be ready within an hour."

"Where will I be going in order to groom you? Do I have to go outside to do that?" you asked.

"Nope! You won't need to leave my body to perform that task. You'll be going back to that chamber where you were forced to clean my virtual representation last time," the bird said with a sneer, "Don't think that I'm naive enough to simply let you walk out of my mouth."

You twisted your face in disgust at the thought. The memories of the dirt and smell quickly resurfaced as well as Ho-oh's cackling face while you polished his talons and beak. You were about to protest but was silenced by Ho-oh's voice.

"But... it'll be a much more pleasant task for you this time," Ho-oh added with an unusually sugary tone, "You'll see when you get there. You have my words... Well then, human. Let's not waste our time lingering here! I'm really looking forward to the grooming you'll provide."

With that said, you made your way back to the chest chamber to fetch your Pokemon. Along the way, you start thinking about all the grooming methods you learned as a Trainer. It's obvious that Legendaries, former Legendary in this case, would require far more than just a simple soap and brush or Pokeblocks to be happy, especially for a prideful one like Ho-oh. But you'll have to give it a try. You noted that Ho-oh seems to have

Once you're in the bedroom again, you found Vaporeon still lounging on the metallic desk next to your bed. You quietly approached the desk and gently stroked her back to wake her up. It made the Pokemon instinctively yawn and stretch herself before looking at you with half-opened eyes.

"Alright, Vaporeon. Time to wake up there, buddy. I have a a special assignment for you," you said.

The Water Pokemon tilted her head with a perplexed look on her face.

"Well, you see... Ho-oh just gave me the opportunity, although the better term would be coerced me, to look after his body in exchange for tokens to purchase goods and necessities. I will have to work for him to sustain our current lifestyle, otherwise he'll impose penalties and downgrade our bedrooms. I don't want to upset Ho-oh or end up sleeping on the floor so I volunteered to help groom Ho-oh which he promised to pay me 300 tokens, enough help us get by for a week. In order to do that, I'll need a little of your assistance."

Vaporeon looked at you with an unchanging expression as her fish-like tail swished about behind her.

"In addition to that, there's no way I can keep you hidden from him forever. Sooner or later I have to reveal you to Ho-oh."

The Pokemon's ears pricked up and yowled loudly at you. It's as if she's protesting your decision.

"I know that. I'm still conflicted whether I should fully trust him or not. His past actions should have made it a resounding no but he's attempting to be nice for once. Unfortunately, I'm not a Psychic Pokemon so I have no method of learning if he's genuine or does he have ulterior motives. This is a risk we'll have to make together. This is the only choice we have right now," you said.

Vaporeon looked unsure for a moment. She remained like that for several minutes but you remained beside her and continue to pat her, trying to reassure the anxious Pokemon that things will turn out for the good. She eventually gave an affirmative cry and leap down from the desk to brush herself against your legs. It her way of saying that it's up to you to decide.

"Thanks, Vaporeon," you chimed as you stroke her head.

You took out your Pokeball and returned Vaporeon to it before clipping it onto your belt.

You asked Ho-oh about the location of the chamber which, if you recalled correctly, is somewhere along the spine.

"For such a memorable experience, I assume that you would at least remember where it took place," Ho-oh said half-derisively.

"For one thing, cleaning your wings is not something I would find memorable. I prefer traumatizing as the description!" you sniped.

"Getting a little cocky, are we?" Ho-oh asked with an amused tone,"....Fine...I'll get you there. Just follow the gold line I made for you."

True to his words, a glowing gold line emerged in the flesh on the floor to lead you. You followed it through a maze of sphincters and hallways, It reminded you of the dreaded body tour you were forced to take previously. The thoughts made you even more nervous about the surprises you might find in your destination. The glowing line led you to one particular sphincter in the hallway.

"Here we are, human," Ho-oh said, "Beyond is where you'll be grooming me. Heh heh heh...Have a good time in there."

You touched the sphincter to open it and walked in. You prepared yourself for the worst of Ho-oh's antics. Instead, you are greeted by something else entirely. It's a location from the outside world. You were standing upon a small hill so you had a good look at your surroundings. A waterfall crested over a rock ledge before falling into a lake with water delivered from other parts of Ho-oh's body. Tall trees in the surrounding area have all turn brilliant hues of red and orange, dancing animatedly in the wind like a blaze. Beside the lake, a majestic pagoda proudly stood against the lavender sky. The 10-story tall structure looks like it has been through centuries without any major repairs. It's fiery red wood frames compliment the fall colors of the place. Ornate gold bells are suspended from each of the four corners on the tallest floor. You walked toward the structure and saw a wooden sign attached at the top of the doors. Though the dark inks were faded by time, it still reads legibly as the 'Bell Tower'. Appropriate enough, you thought as you recalled Ho-oh's legend from Ecruteak City.

A large shadow suddenly loomed over you before you had the opportunity to enter the structure. You looked up and saw Ho-oh's virtual representation is perched on top of the tower.

"There you are, human!" Ho-oh said expectantly as he looked down from above, "It's about time you showed up. "

The Pokemon spread his golden wings and flew down, landing just a few meters in front of you. Ho-oh looks imposing this up close while his red eyes focused on you."

"How's my new place working for you?" the virtual entity said noting your surprised expression, "Illusion spells could get you this far if you're powerful and old enough. Puts all Ninetales out there to shame."

"What is all this for? I thought you wanted me to groom you," you asked.

"That will be discussed later on. For now, I want to make your experience much better than last time. I made this environment more relaxing and familiar for you. I'm curious, human, have you ever visited my hometown before?"

"I've only passed through Ecruteak City once but I haven't really stayed here before," you said admittedly.

"Allow me to correct that. I suggest that you accompany me to the bathhouse in town where I can indulge you in some local hospitality," Ho-oh said with a grin and a mischievous glint in his eyes.
1111111111.title: Trying to Bond with Ho-oh

11111111111.content:
Ho-oh flew to a couple meters over the ground and towards the rest of the town. When you arrived to the town you unconsciously grasped Vaporeon's Pokéball. It had been in this town where you had obtained the Water Stone to evolve her so the town brought back some memories. Despite that moment it was true you had practically passed through without even taking a moment to rest. It was just like two hours.

When you arrived to the town itself Ho-oh flew to the top of the roof of what you supposed was the bathhouse, a large building built traditionally. As you hadn't seen an building this large when you passed through there you suspected it either didn't exist anymore or Ho-oh had enlarged it in his illusion. "It's a beautiful town" you commented with sincerity "Maybe I should have spent a bit more of time when I was in this area"

"You should have" Ho-oh grumbled, getting onto the ground to enter the bathhouse "It's much nicer in person but you won't be going there in the near future"

"By the way, when one says 'let me show you the town's hospitality' normally that doesn't involve giving a bath to who offered it" you said, opening the door. The inside of the bathhouse was quite simple: a round hole taking most of the space inside, lined with blue tiles. Around it you could see furniture with different implements and towels, nothing unusual or strange, at least at first sight.

"That'll have to be when you're done. Have you forgotten what you're here for?" Ho-oh descended into the hole, you noticed it was big enough for him to extend his wings to full span, almost touching the edge. You would be able to crouch comfortably on the edge and work.

"Right. I should get it done. So since we're in a bathhouse how different will this be?"

"I normally don't enjoy water in excess. Swimming is not for me. You'll see later what this is for. Now work!"

The bottom of the pool filled with a shallow layer of water, barely covering Ho-oh's talons. You looked at the tools on the shelves and picked one that resembled a rake. It was good that at least this time you wouldn't need to use your hands or your own clothes. Seeing what you had picked up Ho-oh turned around, showing his back to you and standing as close as possible to the edge. "I'm not completely sure how to use this but it shouldn't be too hard. Stand still"

Ho-oh obeyed and you carefully placed the rake at the base of the neck, dragging it down to the base of the tail. With each stroke the feathers aligned, forming perfect rows.You could see Ho-oh had closed his eyes, the touch of the rake relaxing him. You continued brushing for several minutes until there wasn't a single feather out of place. "Right, this part is done. Extend your wings" Ho-oh obeyed without a word, but after a couple tries you were sure the rake wouldn't work. As nothing else you saw around seemed to work for this you donned a pair of thin gloves you found and carefully aligned the feathers on the wings. Now that there was no pressure on doing the job nor Ho-oh was being a pain on the neck the task was...calming. You had to focus and that kept your mind blank, without any concrete worries.

You never thought you'd truly enjoy it.

Working on the tale was the same than the wings, and after fifteen minutes you had finished that. The hardest part was to style the feathers of the head so it had the shape of the signature crest, but Ho-oh waited with patience. "I'm done here. Turn around" you requested, taking a small towel from a shelf and absorbing a bit of water from the bottom of the pool "This won't take more than five minutes" Ho-oh had opened his eyes and was now staring at you. Seeing those red eyes from so close made you nervous, but you didn't let it show. "Admit I have done it fine so far"

Ho-oh muttered under his breath but you didn't understand any of that. "Yeah, yeah, you did. Much better than I expected"

"That wasn't so hard to admit, was it?" You grinned but before Ho-oh could reply you put the towel on his beak "Now be quiet, this'll be quick" it didn't take long to clean his beak, and soon it was so clean you could almost see your reflection. As soon as you took away the towel the bird crowed.

"It was hard to admit but that's because I can't believe you did this without any protests. You'll have to admit it was better than you thought"

"Since you accepted I did it good then I'll accept it was...fine" you took off your shoes and jumped into the pool. As expected the water felt authentic, it definitely wasn't an illusion. You crouched and moistened the towel again, cleaning the legs and talons. Once you were finished you sighed in relief, happy you had done it even better than last time. Ho-oh would have to admit it too.

"Well done. You'll be paid now" the modified locator on your wrist pinged. 'You have been paid! 300 tokens have been added to your account'. Seeing the reward for your work was nice.

"Since you did this for me then I'll do something for you. This town was created for that, I promised you I'd indulge you in some local hospitality". Ho-oh jumped out of the pool and soon it started filling with warm water, different colors drifting in it. You had the hunch when you entered you'd feel very relaxed.

Grateful, you took off your clothes and submerged in the pool, thoughtful. You had felt Vaporeon's Pokéball on your belt, it was rather amazing Ho-oh hadn't noticed it. Or maybe he had and he just hadn't commented on it, thinking it was empty.

Either way, you thought it'd be good to reveal it. "Um, you know you...found me in that forest, right? I had gone there after training one of my Pokémon..."

"What about that?"

"Well I should say that...I'm not the only guest you have" you took the Pokéball on your belt and threw it in the pool while Ho-oh watched with neutral expression. "This is Vaporeon. It's time for you two to meet"
11111111111.title: In the Bathhouse with Ho-oh

111111111111.content:
Like the previous time, you watched as the water in the center glowed with a brilliant blue light as Vaporeon's form started to materialize from the water. At this point, you are unsure how Ho-oh would react to an additional guest in his body. Would he readily accept her as a friend... or a liability?, you thought. There is possible risk that Ho-oh will have a less-than-friendly reaction to your Pokemon and start punishing you to his liking. It still sends shiver up your spine to imagine being trapped in the colon. Most of all, you had no idea what he would do with Vaporeon. With Ho-oh just becoming a bit more bearable, you quietly hoped that things do not go in that direction.
_____

Ho-oh looked intently at the multicolored lights that is dazzling his eyes. The Pokemon has to admit that it was a spectacular sight. But still a poor analogue to my Sacred Fire. He spotted a shape coming from the depth where the human has thrown the Pokeball. Ho-oh narrowed his crimson eyes and frowned at the device; the sight of it's red and white color is still upsetting for the ex-Legendary. It was the same thing that he was trapped with once and, one day, abruptly released from before he could grasp what had happened. The longer he stared at the Pokeball, the more the memories returned in vivid fashion. That trainer who captured me...the professor...and those wretched experiments...Ho-oh realized that he is about lose control of his temper and quickly pushed the memory of his brief encounter with a previous human to the back of his head. No, I cannot allow that incident to cloud my judgement again. I promised already. Ho-oh took some deep breath and allow himself to regain his composure. Luckily, the human was too absorbed with his own Pokemon to notice any changes in his expression.
_____

Vaporeon emerged from the water with an overjoyed cry. You smiled back at your Pokemon and embraced her while stroking her body gently. You looked toward Ho-oh whose gaze is fixed on the 'newcomer.' Other than that, there is no obvious show of emotion from the bird.

"Hey there, Vaporeon!" you said, "You're looking pretty chipper there, girl."

The Water Pokemon wrapped herself around you with her tail and licked your face.
_____

Surprise, surprise...we have an additional guest. And that means that I have to share even more of my resources, Ho-oh thought amused, And it's a Vaporeon, a Water-type. I don't remember when I've last met one of those things. But it must be about a a decade or two ago. Usually, these creatures are quite shy and hide themselves in the water. But this one looks that it's well-adapted to human contact. Time to take a closer look. Perhaps I could learn a bit more about this human from the Vaporeon. Whether he's good enough for me to give him more respect.
_____

"Okay, that's enough Vaporeon," you chimed as you stroked her head, "Remember what we talked about back in the bedroom. I believe that it is time for both of you and Ho-oh to have a proper introduction."

Vaporeon turned her head and notice the large Pokemon standing next to the large pool. Ho-oh's mere presence seems to intimidate her. You imagined it's due to a combination of his fearsome appearance and your stories about how mean was. You held her up in your arms and presented her to Ho-oh.

"Ho-oh, I would like you to meet Vaporeon," you said. The bird only nodded in acknowledgement, "Vaporeon, this is Ho-oh. He is our host and is kind enough to provide us with this pool I helped groom him."

Without saying a word, Ho-oh craned his head lower toward Vaporeon and scrutinized her in detail. The first impression that he got is that they must have known each other for a long time. Likely since the human became a trainer at a young age. He looked at every visible body part and fins. While Ho-oh tried to look as welcoming as possible, his naturally sharp eyes and talons reduced the effectiveness. He extended one of his wings and used the feather tip to stroke Vaporeon's head. Let's see....Nothing seems out of place. No signs of injuries or stress anywhere. Her teeth are all in pristine condition. All indication is that she's well cared for. It's nice to see this human being so close with her. He silently took note of the stark comparison between Vaporeon and the treatment he endured. She's a lucky one., Ho-oh thought.

From Vaporeon's point of view, Ho-oh looks even more imposing at this distance. One of his eyes alone is about 10 times her size. Those red irises must have probed her for several minutes while you stood there holding your Pokemon. When Ho-oh is finally satisfied with what he saw, he lifted his head and repositioned himself beside the large pool.

"You Pokemon looks....quite beautiful and well-groomed," Ho-oh commented at last, "You must have taken good care of her."

"Thanks. She is one of my favorite Pokemons. I cannot think of leaving on any adventures without her. Is it okay if I keep her in here? I promise that I will be responsible for all her needs," you asked, which sounded a little weird.
____

Ho-oh thought about the potential advantages and disadvantages of having one additional passenger. Pro: The human has someone other than me to talk and play with. I don't have to do anything for the Pokemon, so that's plus. But I'm still not sure if I should charge the human extra for his Pokemon. Con: Vaporeon might get overexcited cause troubles around my body. I cannot let that happen. I need the human to help me regain my Legendary status. Could his Pokemon ruin everything by distracting him from his job?

Ho-oh's thoughts went back and forth for a some times as if each side of his brain is locked in a debate. It wasn't for long before he settled for the best option.
____

"Okay, I've made my decision," Ho-oh said, "After careful consideration, I'll let her stay."

Your face brightened up. "Thank you so much, Ho-oh. Did you hear that, Vappy? You won't have to worry about your living arrangements."

"But you need to follow two conditions I have. First, I want you to keep her out of the Pokeball at all times. Pokemons are supposed to be free to go to anyplace they like and any time they wish without interference from humans. Two, I still want you to reasonably stick to our original goal of getting my Legendary status back. Having your Pokemon on board doesn't mean that our priorities have changed."

"Don't worry, Ho-oh. You have my words. You won't be disappointed. But, why can't I keep Vaporeon in her Pokeball? It's easier to take her around like that."

Ho-oh expression hardened and looked at you. "As I probably told you before, I've had a very bad experience at the hand of a heartless trainer who trapped me in a cramped Pokeball and later abandoned me once he got his Pokedex completed. Seeing any of those things would bring back unhappy memories and those bad moods last for days. Unless you want me to treat you the "old-fashioned" way, for whatever stupid reasons you might have, you better keep Pokeballs and Pokedexes out of my sight."

You recalled that you first heard this story after being tied up in the eye chamber. Ho-oh never went into detail about that incident but you decide not to pursue the topic, at least not now.

"Ummm...Okay, I get you."

You placed the Pokeball away. It would't hurt to let Vaporeon roam around freely. But you may need to keep a closer eye on her lest she gets herself into trouble with Ho-oh.

You and Vaporeon bathed in the pool for about a half more hour before deciding to that you're done and informed Ho-oh.

"Get yourself dressed then, human," Ho-oh said, "The hospitality doesn't just end here. Come, my other representations are waiting."
111111111111.title: Revealing Vaporeon

1111111111111.content:
