Once you were dressed and ready to go you called Vaporeon to your side. It was going to be a bit worrying that Vaporeon was going to be at all times outside of her Pokeball. You still remembered the incident from a year ago inside Lugia, when Vaporeon had wandered away without you and you found her amidst badly done products. Luckily it seemed she wasn't in any danger at any point, but it worries you something like this can happen again.

At least it seems Ho-oh is taking well Vaporeon's presence. You didn't have worry about him treating her wrongly.

"Other representations? You're not going to make me clean all of them, right?" you said almost jokingly. There was a chance it could happen, after all

"No! With a town this big do you think there'd be nobody to take care of everything? There are several like me, with the same memories and all"

"Neat" you reply, not seeing a lot of sense in creating copies just to give you a tour of Ecruteak. You weren't going to complain, though. At least this was interesting and unusual. So, what's going to happen now in your hospitality schedule?"

"Ecruteak is a highly traditional town, valued by its backstories and its attachment to the past. It's to be expected a town like this has a teahouse"

"Right. So we're going to a teahouse. Fine with me" Vaporeon seemed more interested in tea than you, so you were willing to go and accept that possibility for her sake. And even if she didn't want tea, well...it wasn't like you could reject the invitation. You didn't feel comfortable with not going along with what your host had planned, as you feared repercussions. You knew Ho-oh could be very petty.

It was easy to find the teahouse. It was another huge building among the houses and places of normal size. You suspected that if there was anything of big size in this illusion then it meant you would visit it. The teahouse was decorated in an elegant and rather relaxing way, you felt like you could spend hours in there. "Nice job with the, you know...illusion" you complimented, wagging your finger around to point at the decoration.

"It's just like I remember. I haven't been in Ecruteak for a long time"

"Why don't you visit Ecruteak one of these days?"

"I don't feel like it. I'd rather to stay away until you finish your job"

You narrowed your eyes, annoyed. As if you needed more reminders. You already had thought of a plan, but it was mostly a base. The details were hazy and most of your bonding techniques didn't work since you were inside the Pokemon you wanted to bond with. Vaporeon had already met Ho-oh so that part was done...now what?

Soon it was clear what Ho-oh had meant about his representations. From where you thought was an annex room soon came a smaller version of Ho-oh, awkwardly carrying a tray with a big teapot and two teacups. After it was deposited on the table it bowed and went away. "That sure was a thing" you muttered, taking one of the teacups and sliding the other to Ho-oh.

"This was ready for a while. If I had known earlier there was somebody else around I'd have ordered three" Ho-oh said, passing the teacup to Vaporeon with his beak, your friend trying her best to drink it. Not having anything else to say you took a sip of the tea, looking at the tray. There was a folded map on it too, but for the moment you preferred to focus on the tea. It was actually likable and it tasted like it was a blend of several types of plants, but you couldn't recognize which ones. What was sure is that you had never tried anything like it before.

Ho-oh took the map and extended it on the table, revealing it was a map of Ecruteak. There were a few places marked with a red circle, places you had seen already and others that maybe were places of interest. You recognized the tower you had arrived near of, the bathhouse and the teahouse. "What else have you got planned?"

"There's a Theater, a lake and a farm for food nearby. Lots of stores over here and this over here is the Burned Tower. On this side there's a Dojo"

"Right. Am I going to visit all of those?"

"I don't think you will. How long do you plan to be here resting? You're spending some idle time because I was gracious enough to give you a break, not because you should get used to this" the bird admonished, making you roll your eyes behind your hand "You pick the places you want to go but choose carefully. You may want to see as many places as possible but I don't have enough patience for that"

"So much for your hospitality" you said, leaving the map aside "Okay, since you're so interested in pressuring me to do what I can do to restore your status as a Legendary then you tell me what to do"

"Why should I? You're the one who is supposed to do it!"

"...I worded that wrongly" you put your hand on Vaporeon's head, thinking how to make clear what you wanted to know "What I mean is...how can I make you trust me?"

"What?"

"Look, Arceus will give you that status back if he believes we're getting along, okay? But Arceus is, you know, your superior. Doesn't sound to me like he's the kind to be fooled. I'm willing to be your frieeeend..." saying the word with 'Ho-oh' was still difficult for you "...but for that we need to reach mutual understanding, trust each other. I have a few ideas of how we can bond but I want you to tell me:

How can I get you to trust me?"

That was the big question, at least in your opinion. Nothing you did would work if Ho-oh didn't consider it worthy. Maybe asking him directly wasn't a good idea, but it was possible it could save you a lot of time and headaches, at least if he chose to answer.

You waited expectantly for what he could say, hoping that he wouldn't be vague and at least would give you enough hints of what else to do.
1111111111111.title: Ho-oh's Ecruteak Teahouse

11111111111111.content:
Ho-oh thought about the human's question while taking a sip of his tea. The sweet aroma of the herbs did a lot to soothe his anxiety but he still remained uneasy. The Pokemon knew that the question would inevitably come up at some point. But the timing couldn't have been worse: he hasn't given much thought about it. How am I suppose to start? Arceus told me that this trust business has to be mutual for it to work. Without that, any attempt at friendship is doomed to failure. Meaning, I also need to earn the human's trust...somehow... Ho-oh looked at the human who didn't break off eye contact with him. He was beginning to feel uneasy at the attention he was getting. Okay, better say something and look good.

"It would depend on you actions, human. I will make my decision when the time comes," Ho-oh said in a measured tone.

"That doesn't feel like an answer to me. I intend to hear something more specific," you responded. You are not buying his ambiguous explanation and the Pokemon seemed to take note of that.

The bird thought deeply about his answer and cleared his throat.

"Simply put....I...want you to prove to me that you are not like the humans I encountered before you," Ho-oh said, "I don't want you using me like I'm some type of expendable object to satisfy your needs. I want you to treat me in a fair and deferential manner."

"Alright," you replied calmly, "That sounds easy enough. I'm not the kind of person who exploit others for personal gain, so you can rest assured about that. But I still have doubts about your intentions, Ho-oh."

"Might I ask why....," Ho-oh frowned at the last part.

"You see, your previous actions made me doubt your sincerity," you said without hesitation, "Yes, you've tempered your attitude down a bit and treated me to some of your most generous hospitalities yet. I appreciate that. But how can you prove that everything you're doing is genuine and not some charm offensive."

"Why would I do something that is obviously not in my interest, even jeopardize my very existence?" Ho-oh asked, "I haven't mistreated you in any ways. I did everything I can to make my body comfortable for you. Most of all, I genuinely want to change. It's everything you could have asked for."

"Let's make a little assumption, supposedly if Arceus hadn't taken away your Legendary status and powers, would you be this nice to me? Or would you still be your mean old self, making life miserable for me?"

"........Hmmm...I... ," Ho-oh mumbled.

Ho-oh knew that the human was right to a certain extent: he would've made the him suffer under his old habits. That was until "The Original One" changed that. The long lecturing aside, being mostly stripped of his Special Power made Ho-oh feel vulnerable for the first time in a millennium. But he never revealed this feeling to anyone but himself. Any show of weakness was unthinkable for Ho-oh. After being repeatedly turned away and mocked by his former equals, he soon found out that his haughty attitude isn't going to earn him sympathy from either other Legendaries or any humans.

"I'll admit, human," Ho-oh said, "I would have been my old self: prideful and abusive. But...that was before I met Arceus and endured the subsequent events. Being powerless isn't fun you know."

"I trust that Arceus has laid out some conditions for you."

"He did. The gist of the long list he gave me; He want me to be friends with you specifically and learn to better myself through my interaction with you."

"And would be the consequences if you break the agreement once he restored your full status and revert to your old ways?"

"No, never. Lord Arceus is no fool, human," Ho-oh replied gravely, " If I violate any terms, he could very well take away what he returned to me with a flick of his powers. If severe enough, he'll just blink me out of existence, completely erased without a trace. By then, even you won't realize what happened since your memories are also changed. To defy "The Original One" may very well be a death wish."

"That's not something I would like to experience, much less you."

"Now that I laid out my conditions for me to trust you," Ho-oh said diplomatically, "It's time for me to ask you the same question in return: Tell me, what do I have to do for you to trust me, human?"

"Hmm...it's not hard to answer. You could be a bit less arrogant and cocky. That's a big sticking point in my opinion," you said, "I also want you to treat me fairly. Most of all, you need to follow through on your promise of changing for the better. When you demonstrate that you are serious, then I could better trust you. As things currently are, my 'trust meter' is wobbling between "Yes" and "No"."

"I'll try my best to do all of your wishes. But don't get too excited, human, " Ho-oh warned jocularly, "Some of my habits can be difficult to kick out, especially my cockiness. Plus, parts of my old personality isn't completely gone yet. You're gonna need some excellent patience dealing with me."

Ho-oh put on a smug expression toward you. The remark about his 'old personality' sound weird enough but doesn't disturb you much.

"We'll have to take baby steps then, Ho-oh," you sighed.

"Hmm...great. I'm sure our new relationship is off to a "good start,"" Ho-oh remarked before sipping his tea again.
_____

You and Ho-oh drank the last of your tea before leaving the teahouse. The little Ho-oh came out and thanked you two for your patronage and escorted you two to the entrance. The sun is just setting in this artificial environment. Ho-oh flew up and glided in the orange skies anove you. You noticed the some changes about the town. The streets of the ancient town felt lively as many representations of the Pokemon, young and old, strolled in traditional clothing. It was strange to see each of the Ho-ohs having different eye colors, body shape, and different styling on their crest.Some of the representation noticed you and greeted you. Food stands are lined at the side of the street selling everything from pastries to exotics delicacies. The appropriate prices are all listed in tokens. The bird children are particularly lively as they hovered around with their kites and lantern in their wings. It reminded you of the festivals you used to play at when you're younger. Some of the female Ho-ohs cladded in beautiful robes and paper umbrellas looked at you while giggling. You blushed and smiled back.

"So where are we going next as our final stop?" Ho-oh asked from above.
11111111111111.title: About Trusting You

111111111111111.content:
"Final stop? But there were so many options in the map" you protested, you thought the tour of Ecruteak would last longer. Maybe if you hadn't taken so long in the bathhouse or encouraged a discussion about trusting each other then you would have got time to see more.

"It's getting late. Didn't you see the sunset?"

"I thought it was something supposed to happen. Is it sunset outside too?"

"It is. Hurry up and choose!"

"Um" if you remembered the map correctly the farm was the one furthest away and the theater the closest to where you were. Normally you would have gone for the Burned Tower, but this was a festival! You had been in festivals before specially when you were a child but obviously not in one populated only by this species. It sure was an experience. As such you wanted to go to a place that could be linked to this "The theater. That should be the final stop"

"It's over there" Ho-oh started leading you to your decided place, while you looked around trying to see a bit of everything. When you got caught by Ho-oh 36 hours before this moment you never imagined at the next day you'd be in a simulated festival in an old version of Ecruteak, going with Ho-oh as if he were no more than a tour guide. This wasn't really what you imagined your days would be.

Vaporeon, walking to your side, was specially enchanted by the surrounding things. You were carrying her so she wouldn't get lost in the crowd and you could hear her happiness from everything. At least there was somebody openly enjoying the hospitality. After buying a couple pastries for you and Vaporeon you reached Ho-oh in front of the Theater. "Buying things already?" Ho-oh eyed the pastry in your hand.

"I was starving. Besides I have more than enough tokens, why not to spend them?"

"That sounds like you won't work tomorrow"

"Why should I? I got paid and I can live for a while from that. There's no reason for me to break my back working everyday" Besides it was also a way to try to start the whole bonding thing too. Most tasks doesn't seem to me like they can work for that objective you thought, entering the building. While Ho-oh seemed like he wanted you to make yourself useful everyday he didn't protest.

The Theater was relatively crowded, with more Ho-ohs. There were no seats, so sitting on the floor was the only option. Getting as close to the platform as possible you relaxed, waiting for the show to start. "So what'll happen here?"

"Because you're surely ignorant of everything about Ecruteak history I thought you should educate yourself" Ho-oh replied, making his jab towards you be as glaring as possible.

"I know about history but I suppose it will be okay to see the play" You had chosen to be there, you may as well enjoy what there's to see.

As if the play had been waiting for your approval to start soon the Theater dimmed and focused all the lighting onto the platform. Somehow backgrounds and props appeared from nowhere, freshly created for the illusion. It showed an even older version of Ecruteak, if that was possible, with a prop of two towers on each side of the platform. What you watched followed pretty closely the tale you had heard about. The Burned Tower, originally called the Brass Tower, was hit by lightning, Pokemon died and were revived as new Legendaries, and Lugia and Ho-oh left the town.

Every character involved was played by a Ho-ohs with masks. It broke the immersion to see birds with masks that were clearly of completely different species, but at lest the quality of the acting helped to make that not be bothersome.

As the Theater, the props and the actors were all part of an illusion that gave Ho-oh complete liberty to make everything as impressive as possible. The play was full of amazing effects and you enjoyed everything, rather impressed by the quality of the events. When it was over you gave a sincere applause, thankful of having seen everything.

"That was awesome! You said, exiting the Theater. Ho-oh was pretty smug about your appreciation, and slowly the illusion was over. Everything around you slowly vanished until you found yourself in the empty chamber you had been in a year ago for a task that wasn't nice at all. The contrast between your experience a year ago and now was pretty obvious.

"Of course it was. That was the Ecruteak hospitality. I haven't been in the town for a long time but I'm sure they still do all this"

"Well it's not a town anymore. It's a city, but it's still traditional, judging from what I saw when I passed there. I think you'd still like it"

As Ho-oh's representation couldn't leave the chamber he stopped at the entrance. "Anything else to say?"

You did have something to say. "I have been thinking about what we talked about and...well I'm glad we're at least getting along. This was a good day"

"Since you're going to be lazy and not do any work tomorrow what will you do?"

"I suppose not much other than just...moving around. This is a living body, there must be stuff to see. Sure, I saw a lot last time and frankly around half of those are places I don't want to see again, but that isn't all there's to see" You looked at Vaporeon for a moment "I also need to find a place for Vaporeon to be in. Some exercise would do her some good, so if I can find a large empty space then great"

"I can do something about that" Ho-oh of course was much more courteous towards Vaporeon than towards you. You couldn't avoid feeling somewhat annoyed about that, for some reason.

"Great. Good night" you said, going out, once again alone with Vaporeon and without the overbearing bird aside you. Sure, you were still inside him, but that wasn't the same thing.

When you arrived to your bedroom you went straight to your bed while Vaporeon settled again in the desk. Since you weren't going to use Vaporeon's Pokeball for a while you threw it against a corner and fell asleep. Overall the day had gone much better than expected.

You doubted all days would have something like what happened today, but as long as your host did nothing against you you were fine with just living inside for now and trying to achieve mutual trust. How long would that take, though?

Lugia's arrival was still scheduled for into nine days. If she got worried about you then...she may suspect something was going on. Would she look for Ho-oh? Chances are that she would and once she did...well, you two had some sort of psychic connection. She'd feel you inside him and you feared she wouldn't let you continue working on this.

That is, if by that time you were willing to vouch for Ho-oh.

Contacting Lugia was not an option, it was pretty much impossible that the bird would allow you to do that and even if he let you you didn't want to tell her what was going on. You weren't sure she'd allow it.

But if I can't tell Lugia then maybe there's some way to make it seem like there's nothing going on and I just can't get to the meeting, but I'd need help for that. There was one Pokemon that could help in some regard. Floatzel.

Still, at normal size and all you never had a way to contact other Pokemon. Sending messages to them would be enough to make alarms sound, but if you had to choose then telling Floatzel what was going on was better. You made a mental note to try to convince Ho-oh to let you tell him about all this.
111111111111111.title: Theater

1111111111111111.content:
Morning came faster than you imagined. The beeping sound of the locator served to rouse you from your dreams. You had dreams of meeting up with Lugia and playing with her as if nothing had happened. Unfortunately, the alarm dissipated that illusion. It can't be that soon, you thought. You recalled lying down on your bed and fell asleep in a minute. But a quick look at the locator indicated that it's 8:00 in the morning. Perfect.[/i}

"Time to get up, human!" Ho-oh's voice boomed.

"Urggh...," you groaned, "Can't you lower your voice please? I didn't feel that I have slept at all."

"That's you're problem, human," Ho-oh squawked, "Even though you don't plan to work today, I can't have you lazing off for an entire day."

"Who said that I'm gonna waste my day in bed," you said as you stretched your arms, "I'm gonna go on some tours around you body."

"Whatever," the bird said nonchalantly, "I can't stop you. Anyways, you're free to go anyplace but my brain. That is the one place I don't want you prodding around. Don't think that I have forgotten your last antic."

Ho-oh placed special emphasis on the last sentence.

"Oh, don't worry Ho-oh, I'll listen to you," you grinned, "Trust me, I don't want to see any more of your weird fantasies."

"What...," Ho-oh gritted, "Must you mention that? I'm still upset at whoever made those scandalous leaks."

"Perhaps you should beef up on your security next time," you cracked.

"Grrr...Oh forget it! Go and get your breakfast."

You savored the little victory you had as you walked to the small room that has become your new dining chamber. You noticed that there is a new sign fixed to the wall, along with a sensor for your locator.

Herbs and berries ---------------- 5 tokens
Wild Fruits----------------------------7 tokens
Nut Mix--------------------------------4 tokens
Berry drink---------------------------3 tokens

"These are the foods I have today. Make your choice, human."

"More choices today I have some Wild Fruits. I haven't eaten anything fresh since you captured me."

"Hold on there," Ho-oh said.

Ho-oh dropped some fruits through the opening above the ledge. You initially assumed that the Pokemon would've given something familiar like grapes or at least fruits that look edible. If only things were like that... The fruits are weirdly-shaped and are of varieties you haven't even seen before. Where could Ho-oh possibly get these? Did he just randomly grabbed these from the forest? What if these are poisonous to humans?

"Ho-oh, are you sure I could eat those safely?"

"Why don't you find out yourself?" Ho-oh jabbed, "I've eaten those all my life with no ill effects."

You looked at the pile of bite-sized fruit on the table with apprehension. The blemished skins didn't help at all and only made them look rather unappetizing. But then, you heard you stomach growl and your throat feels parched. I guess that I can't be a chooser. You took a small bite of the bright pink fruit that resembles an cherry. It's surprisingly sweet and soft. You helped yourself to more of the other fruits, each of them is distinctly sour, bitter, sugary, and even salty.

"At least it's better than half-digested herbs and grass, I suppose," you said out loud.

"Of course they are. It took me more time to collect those fruit. It'll cost you 7 tokens for those."

You heard another beep from the locator, indicating another transaction.

Once you finished you're breakfast, you got up and returned to your bedroom. Vaporeon is already awake and sitting on your feathery bed. She looked happy to see her trainer returning to her.

"Take Vaporeon with you, human. I have made something for her."

You remembered the request you made. "You finished the place you meant for Vaporeon?"

"Yes. Just follow the gold line like last time," Ho-oh said.

You followed the gold line with Vaporeon close behind. This time the light took you to a lower part of Ho-oh's body. You wondered what kind of place did Ho-oh prepared for your Pokemon. The gold line stopped at another sphincter which you opened promptly. You entered a room that contains a fleshy maze about the height of your knee. At the center of the circular maze is a tall tree-like structure consisting of stairs, holes, mini-waterfalls, and ledges. There are metallic poles sticking out around the perimeter with an organic mesh. A door on the ground floor allowed you to explore the interior of the the structure.

Once you're inside, you amazed at how opulent Ho-oh made the place. The place is decorated in the regal gold, orange and green of your host. A large circular rug with an ancient pictograph of Ho-oh is laid at the center. There are various furniture like a table, cushions, couch, shelves filled with toys, picture frames with aerial scenery, and even a large television screen displaying what the bird is seeing. There is also a bed similar to yours next to the couch. Right next to the bed are plates containing water and fresh fruits. And to further add to the extravagance, there is a tub that is large enough to fit both you and Vaporeon comfortably.

Vaporeon ran over to the new attractions and gleefully rolled around on the rug. The bird smiled at how happy the human's Pokemon is.

But for you, it is the ultimate envy; it's has the comfort and luxury of a Secret Base that you maintained. It's something that Ho-oh is very reluctant to provide you with.

"Ho-oh, you seem to prefer the company of Vaporeon over me. I know you're still iffy over humans but I think you should be fair here," you said with a hint of annoyance.

"She and I are both Pokemons, human," he said as matter-of-factly, "Isn't it obvious to you that I'm going to treat her preferentially?"

"Well, of course I consider that. But this is absolutely favoritism at its worst," you retorted.

Ho-oh only laughed much to your frustration. "Who said that I only cared for Vaporeon? I also made some arrangements for your free day."
1111111111111111.title: Starting Another Day

11111111111111111.content:
"Arrangements" The word sounded ominous. If it weren't because you knew you two were striving to get along you'd suspect the worst. "What type of arrangements?"

"Since you don't feel like working and you don't intend to do anything other than walking around I have planned something for you. It's an attempt to make up for what happened a year ago. Take a look at this"

A pile of membranes you remembered were the equivalent of paper in his body fell in a corner of the place, most of them being maps to arrive to different organs, in case you forgot how. Leaving Vaporeon to enjoy the amenities your host had provided her you picked the sheet at the top. "Make up to what happened, you say?" You were reading a list of the many sufferings you had in your first stay inside him, listed by place and what happened in there. It wasn't a long list, but it still made you cringe.

"Since I was at my worst a year ago I have decided to show you my best. The places you see here were all related to your suffering and I want to show you the better side of them"

"Right" The concept of the idea was encouraging but the execution may not be the best. "There are a few I want to cross out of this list here. I'd be fine with the rest"

"Are you sure? I have something planned for every place in there"

"I'm completely sure. I don't really feel like remembering my traumas"

"I thought you were going to trust me" Ho-oh said, being manipulative. "You won't acknowledge you can trust me if you don't let me show you"

"Look, I do want to trust you but I don't feel ready for some of these" And I honestly doubt I ever will. I could think a hundred better ways than revisiting certain places. Ho-oh, realizing you wouldn't accept it, could only sigh. A thin bar of an unknown material fell near to you, so you picked it up and wrote a few words to the side of some items in the list.

Place - What Happed a Year Ago

Eyes - Cleaning
Intestines -Spending the Night/Cleaning As if you could make something good happen there.
Surveillance Room - Surveillance It's mind-numbing boring to watch screens without anything happening. Don't want to do it again
Foundry - Quick check
Projection Room - Grooming You already crossed this off. I suppose your hospitality there yesterday is what inspired you to go for the rest too.
Kidneys - Rigged Questionnaire Almost rejected it but...I admit I'm somewhat curious as to what you may have planned that's actually good. Not sure.
Message Relay System - Fixing
Reproductive Organs - Pleasure Game I still need therapy for all that.
Various Places - Miscellaneous Working I suppose everything else fits here, but no idea what you could do. Let's pass.

You had never really noticed that when it was put like that there weren't that many things you did a year ago. It was even shorter because he had made clear you weren't going into his brain and some of the things you had to do had been in there. "I'm done here"

"I can see what you wrote. Aren't you being excessively picky? You crossed off around half of the list"

"Excuse me for not being enthusiastic about some of the options" you say with some bitterness, toying with the locator. You hadn't used the shock function for almost a whole day and with some luck you wouldn't need to for another.

Ho-oh understood what your tone meant. "Okay, I get it. Let's get this over with. Your ungratefulness frustrates me but I won't force you to do anything"

"Good. Keep that in mind and we'll get along" you stood up, picking the maps you needed and leaving them aside for reference. "You lead the way. It's fair, I rejected some so I think you should at least decide the order I should go around"

"Here's the way" a way out of Vaporeon's new home was opened, and after saying goodbye to your Pokemon you walked into the road, wondering where Ho-oh had decided your day should start.
11111111111111111.title: Ho-oh's Plan for You

111111111111111111.content:
"This better not be another one of your pranks, you hear?" you warned Ho-oh.

"You have my words. No more pranks," Ho-oh said, "If you think otherwise, feel free to use the shocker."

"I'm more than happy to oblige," you grinned.

As you moved down the tunnel, you began to imagine what Ho-oh might have in store for you and you aren't exactly excited about them. Although the Pokemon told you that he will show you the best behavior he got, you still find it difficult to take his words at face value. Ho-oh has a peculiar way of defining things and he "being his best" would be no exception. I doubt that his good side can last a minute. In fact, even I am getting sick and tired of being so cynical toward Ho-oh. However, changing someone's personality doesn't come easily...

Ho-oh eventually led you to the eye chamber. When you saw the familiar pair of window-like openings, your mind was taken back to the last time you stepped foot in this place. You were then attempting an escape after being unceremoniously eaten by the Legendary and forced to listen to Ho-oh spew out his anti-human lecture. All while being bound by cords and later forced to wash his filthy eyes.

Putting the negative thoughts aside, you examined the chamber. The place looks far more welcoming today. The fleshly walls and floors are gone, replaced with brightly-colored, felt-like surfaces. The surface of the Ho-oh's eyes are crystal clear without any dirt or grime, allowing rays from the morning sun to cast a bright glow to the room. A bronze sculpture of your host stood prominently on a pedestal, one that depicts him in flight. Interesting choice of artwork...

Right in the middle, there is a large soft cushion chair and a table facing the windows. The sofa felt velvety when you sat and lie down on it.

Everything about the eye chamber far is a cry from its spartan-like appearance when you first found your way here.

You eyed the walls and spied the many pictures hanging on it. They depicted Ho-oh together with some of his friends in a variety of locations. It struck you as sad as some of those Pokemons might have broke off with Ho-oh after his nefarious deeds were revealed. When you saw the smiles Ho-oh shared with the other Legendaries in the photos, you wondered if Ho-oh truly deserved to be punished so severely.

You noticed a piece of translucent paper is placed on the table together with a large glass of fizzling drink:


"Welcome to the New Eye Chamber!" A complimentary glass of my best alcoholic drink. Try it!

I hope you like the huge upgrade I made to the place. Once again, I truly want to make up for how I treated you. Let's start amending..."

Just sit back and enjoy the ride :)

---Ho-oh



You set aside the piece of paper and took a sip of the drink. It's refreshing and sweet with a mild aroma of alcohol that isn't too over-powering.

"Relax a bit while I plan out where else I can take you," Ho-oh said before he flew higher.

You sat and stared absentmindedly at the clouds and counted the banks and turns that Ho-oh made in his flight. In parts where the clouds parted, islands and cities resembled miniature model several thousands feet above ground. The other time you were this high up was on a plane flight from Kanto to Hoenn. But compared to the teeny portal while you're stuck in the metal fuselage, Ho-oh's eye chamber offered a far larger and majestic view. The fact that you have a comfy seat all to yourself also helped. The leisurely gliding made it all the more enjoyable. Eyeing the earth beneath, you have to admit that the world looks beautiful from this high up; it gave you a sense of power and dominance like you never felt before. For a brief moment, you imagined yourself having sovereignty over everything below you; you had the world at your whim. It's perhaps that same feeling that influenced your host's personality.

"Hard to believe that it was a year ago when we first met," you recalled.

"Getting a little nostalgic already? I left quite the impression in you" Ho-oh grinned.

"Not really. You were giving me that cheesy lecture about humans being a pain in your rear at this very place. I wouldn't call that good memory."

"But it is for me," the Pokemon said, "I still remember the look on your face when you were tied down. Hahaha..."

"Could we not mention that again," you groaned, "I want to forget that."

"I'll admit, I went overboard. But my points still stands and you, my friend, are the living proof of it."

"That's a product of your misguided mind and an overgeneralization of all humans," you replied curtly.

"Misguided? I think the same can be said about you, human. You're attempting to reform a thousand years-old (ex-)Legendary that treated you more like dirt, acted like a smartass, and just being plain obnoxious to you. Attempting to fix someone you don't really trust at all, I'd say that's insanity."

You sighed at the remark. "Touché. Maybe reforming you is too much to ask of me. But it's worth the try to get you to at least like me."

You looked down and studied the map Ho oh gave you. There are more places and labels but they're mostly generic rooms. One of them, however, caught your attention. It's a room in Ho-oh's brain labeled "The Suite".

"What's that over here?" You said while tapping on the location.

"The best room I got in my body. But you're still far from going there. That's where you'll live once you have my complete trust. And by current progress, it's still a long shot. Say, since you literally crossed off half of the choices I gave you. Would you like me to show you some other places that you haven't been to before?"

"What other places could you possibly have? Another strange organ designed to irritate the heck out of me? I'm unconvinced that you might have more places worth showing," you said while gazing out the window.

"You said that as if you aren't already annoyed about my body. No need for me to add more salt to your pessimism. Unless...of course, you have a penchant for being played with. I would gladly accommodate you," Ho-oh beamed mischievously.

You gave the shock button on your locator a light tap and heard Ho-oh gave an feminine squeal. His whole body shuddered from the quick jolt.

"Ow...," Ho-oh screeched.

"Alright, that's enough Ho-oh!" you jested, "You should learn to tame that smug beak. Could you please tell me where you plan on taking me next?"

Just then, you saw one of Ho-oh's wing come into view in the eye windows and playfully gave you a poor imitation of obscene human gestures with his primary feathers. Pfft, you're even doing it wrong, birdbrain.

"Hmpph, that really discourteous, human. Do you even have a sense of humor?"

"Definitely not your type, Ho-oh."

"Fine....I'll take you to the Shopping Arcade. Come along," the Pokemon said docilely This feels weird but I'm liking this guy more and more. Maybe it's time for some pleasant surprises to kickstart our bonding.
111111111111111111.title: A Day of Making Amends

1111111111111111111.content:
You had to admit everything so far was much better than you expected. Vaporeon's new home hadn't given you any hopes of being treated correctly but Ho-oh was actually showing a will to treat you well.

You had to give credit where it's due: this could work. It may not be today or tomorrow, but looks like you and him could be friends.

Ho-oh led you through his winding innards until you got to a long organ. When you stepped in you felt yourself sinking up to your ankles, the floor was some kind of extremely soft rug. You waddled through the rug until you got to the nearest furniture, which seemed to be a cash register. "I suppose nothing in here will be free" you said, poking the register.

"Of course nothing is free! This is the Shopping Arcade, not the Take-All-You-Want Arcade" Ho-oh replied to you "Besides you have enough tokens to spend"

"Right" That had some logic. You had to admit he was right. You walked the best you could to the baskets and shelves filled to the brim with objects "So, what do you have in here you think I'd like? I'm not picky so if you have anything feel free to tell me"

"Is it not enough to see the wide variety I have in here?"

"It's impressive, but surely there must be something you specialize in, something nobody else would be able to replicate. Even if I can't buy it at least it should be nice to see the best object you have in here" It was more a challenge than anything else. You wanted to see what was the best thing Ho-oh could create and judging by the bragging that came shortly after that your host understood what you meant.

The ceiling of the Shopping Arcade lighted up, pointing you to the back of the store. While you walked you noticed the first section, the one nearest to the entrance, was the most common stuff. There were practical objects, normally seen for everyday life. Clothes, mostly. Since the ones you were wearing were starting to tear you made a mental note to buy some of Ho-oh's products.

Then came the furniture, as expected most of them with avian features. Wings and feathers were the prominent elements and although you weren't a person big on decoration you had to admit you wanted a couple of those. However when you took a look at the prices you had to forget that. You weren't going to pilfer your hard-earned tokens on that unless you wanted to eat grass for six months.

Then came the most expensive stuff, mostly art. Ho-oh seemed pretty good at sculpting, specially with gold. You remembered that he had some sort of foundry somewhere, you had been there once, but you had never really been able to see what he could do with that. You didn't even bother to check the price because you didn't want to feel just how little money you had.

"Now that I wonder, what's up with Pokemon having stores inside them? Who buys these?"

"We don't keep them inside us forever. Sending and receiving stuff is normal for us, you wouldn't understand how it works"

"I can't even understand how you create them" you shrugged. That was a good explanation as any. You supposed after it was paid they enlarged the stuff or something, unless they liked to play interior decorators inside their own bodies. It wasn't any of your business.

You finally got to what seemed the exact middle of this place. Right there, hanging on the wall, you could see what definitely fit as Ho-oh's best and most impressive object. It was an extraordinarily long woven picture, made of minuscule threads. In it was depicted Ho-oh in flight, practically everything in Johto under him. Above there were constellations you didn't recognize. It was overall a beautiful work of art. "You did this?"

"No, it was a gift to me, long ago. We don't squander in lavish gifts when there's a special occasion for that, surely unlike you"

"You know nothing about my gift giving habits. I suppose there's a story behind who gave you this, right?"

"There is but you won't be hearing it. It's private" Just like you expected "But since you're in this part I may as well show you the main reason why I brought you here. Keep going, it's just a little further than this"

You could see nearby that it was called a Shopping Arcade in every way of the word. There were machines, surely they were games for you to play. "What about those?"

"I want to challenge you. Each game costs a token per play, but that shouldn't be a problem for you"

"Thank you for telling me, but what challenge is this? See who is the best in these games?"

"Why not to play against each other? There's nothing for you to do and I'm so good I can fly and play at the same time. I could even do another dozen things meanwhile"

"What you want is to give me a defeat in those games of yours. Something likely to happen since you have more experience and all" Although your words seemed like you were annoyed your tone was more amused than anything else. It was a nice enough way to pass the time, besides a friendly competition between you two should help bonding. You reckoned this was a very accurate way to get you to do something with him.

"You'll accept, won't you?"

"Of course I will. Bring it on"
1111111111111111111.title: The Shopping Arcade

11111111111111111111.content:
Ho-oh willed another representation to materialize in front of you. Bright flashes and dazzling colors materialized before your eyes. You stood by as you looked as the details of the figure gradually took form. When the process is completed, it looked markedly different from his first representation. Instead of the avian body shape you're so used to, Ho-oh made himself more human-like. His new form is slightly taller than you complete with human hands and feet. His body is still covered in a thin layer of fur while his fingernails are green with white tips. The bird's head remained the same as his original one. Ho-oh wore a long sleeved shirt and a pair of dark blue pants and sport shoes. To add even more authenticity, Ho-oh has a belt with a Pokedex and Pokeball holder clipped on. But you think that the accessories are merely decorative. Top down, Ho-oh looks like any trendy trainers you might meet from the city. The Pokemon gave you a toothy grin.

"Let's go," Ho-oh said confidently, "It's time for some friendly competition."

"You said that as if you're ever going to play fair, Ho-oh," you rolled your eyes, "You've got a home advantage over me and you want me to trust that you won't rig the game in your favor?"

"I'll play fair as long as you also do so pal," Ho-oh replied, "Won't you trust the new and improved Ho-oh?"

"Not enough to believe that you will be honest. You're will find ways to make me do stupid things."

"Well, that's not my problem them," the humanoid bird shrugged and gave you a pat on your back, "Alright then. Suit yourself. But you're forfeiting some really grand prizes I got."

"More souvenir stuffs I don't need," you said flatly.

"Nope. It's something better. But you'll have to win me to find out. A hint though, it's a new privilege for you," Ho-oh beamed gleefully.

"I still wonder why I decided to put up with your game," you sighed.

Ho-oh walked toward the arcade without looking back toward you.

You and Ho-oh head over to several roles of arcade consoles with names like "Whack a Lugia!", "Airborne Wings", "Pokemon Battles" and even "Legend of Ho-oh". Other games are mostly those that you would find in a fun park. Obviously, most of the games aren't anything original or innovative as they are more of an imitation of various well-known games. This should be easy, you thought.

"Alright, let's start playing!" Ho-oh smiled.

You and Ho-oh started your duel by playing on the "Whack a Lugia!" The mechanism of the game is identical to it's real word counterpart, only replacing the Digletts with poorly-designed Lugia's head. It felt a little strange every time you lowered the foam hammer wherever the head pops up. Ho-oh must've made this game as a sort of 'take that' at his nemesis. His opinion of her apparently hasn't improved with time.

It left you to wonder if you will ever be allowed to contact Lugia or Floatzel. You wanted to tell them that you are with Ho-oh and that he is treating you well so far. Ho-oh won't permit that. At least, not at this time. But knowing Lugia, IF Ho-oh somehow allowed you to use the Pokenet to call her, it is likely that she will overreact and fly straight into Ho-oh's face and confront him at the worst possible time. That's not the outcome you want. Ho-oh and you are just getting along better now and you don't want to destroy this budding friendship. Perhaps it is best to wait a little while. Maybe, he will open up a little about his feud with Lugia.
____

After hours of playing through the flight simulator and a well-designed Pokemon fighting game, you and Ho-oh have tied. You spent about 20 tokens on these games including paying for Ho-oh's round.

"Not bad, human," the humanoid bird said, "It's been a long time since I came across such opponent."

"Most of the games you have here, I've aced them a long time ago," you put bluntly, "But we're still tied so that obviously mean no prize for me."

"Correct. But I'm about to offer you a way to win possibly win this competition and also earn some extra tokens."
____

Ho-oh led you over across several rows of slot machines. The sight brought back memory of an news report you seen on TV about the replacement of the Game Corner. The move was controversial. Its slot machines used to be one of the must-see sights of Goldenrod City until it's was decided to replace them with a less engaging game of Voltrob Flip. The city explained need to cleanse the city of its tarnished image of being a place for excessive gambling. Team Rocket and their hijacking of the radio tower didn't help either. In your opinion, the city lost its soul the day the Game Corner closed.

"You know what, Ho-oh, these reminds me that there's no more slot machines left in Goldenrod," you said sadly.

"I heard about that from a Pokenet conversation too. It's bad enough you humans always find ways to ruin your entertainments. Goldenrod doesn't feel the same without a Game Corner. A sad loss indeed," the bird shook his head.

"But nothing can be done about that now. It's now all about Voltrob Flip in the city."

"What's that?" Ho-oh asked inquisitively.

"Oh, the game is a flip card game that depends completely luck. And it's notorious for giving out very few wins," you explained, "I'd like to think of the change as a conspiracy by the city to bilk more money out of the tourists."

"Well, these slot machines are not exactly the same as real world versions are. Guaranteed to get you addicted."

"I must say, I'm not much of a risk taker though. And addiction to slot machines isn't rally healthy. I don't want to lose any more of my hard-earned tokens on these things."

"Oh come on," Ho-oh looked at you with a 'faked' hurt expression, "Just play a few rounds with me and I'll be happy. Isn't that the whole point of gambling?"

"But I thought gambling is more of a human thing?" you said dryly.

"Who said so?" Ho-oh frowned, "Pokemons are just as likely as you to make bets. I used to play these games with my other friends...or former friends in this case. We did some gambling but we mostly bet on goods like those in my shop," Ho-oh waved his hands around the mall arcade, "But be prepared, when it comes to slot machines, I consider myself an ace. Wanna try your luck, human?"

"Sure, why not? I want to see if you really live up to that moniker. Slot machines are a game of luck too. This better be good," you smiled widely which made Ho-oh flinch for a second.
11111111111111111111.title: Playing Games

111111111111111111111.content:
The slot machines made you nervous. The good thing is that it took a few minutes for you to consider them being rigged on your host's favor. In a sense that was progress, the possibility didn't jump to your mind as soon as you saw them. You thought of that as once another sign you were trusting Ho-oh more than you considered possible.

In a way that was a relief.

You say in front of the machines while Ho-oh went to a different one. "So, how will we do this?" you asked.

"Let's play for a max of five minutes. The one who earns the most tokens wins"

"Do you even have tokens?"

"I provide them. I technically have infinite tokens, remember?" That made sense, although now you didn't take very well how you had to pay for his rounds in the other games. You were given a bunch of stones that represented the tokens you had earned so far. You took one and inserted it in the machine, earning a game. Ho-oh was already playing several rounds, managing to win one. The cascade of stones clanked against the floor. "I'm already doing great here!"

"Good for you" you pulled from the lever and watched the slots spin until they all showed a drawing of an X. A complete loss of a single token. It wasn't too much but you at least felt the thrill of seeing how the slot machines worked. It wasn't long before you started putting in several tokens at once, hoping for a big prize. Each time you lost you felt a growing frustration while Ho-oh kept racking in some victories.

You knew you were losing. When there was only one minute left you decided to take a risk. "I'm going all in" you said aloud, hoping it'd work. Ho-oh turned his head around and grinned.

"Is that so? I'll do the same, then. I'm in a lucky strike right now"

It had worked. Ho-oh wouldn't resist triumphing over you specially if you were doing something unusual. Both of you placed all your remaining tokens in the machine and pulled the lever. Much to your surprise you finally got lucky in the sense it wasn't a complete loss like all rounds before! And much to your annoyance you only recovered half of the tokens you had at the beginning.

You peered at Ho-oh's slot machine to see his result. It was the same result than yours but since he had placed much more tokens than you his halved result was bigger than yours. He had won. "I knew I would win! Told you I was an ace, human"

"It was just good luck" you grouched "If it had been a different type of game I would have won"

"Then why did I just win our little competition? This was the tiebreaker and I won. Anybody would have seen it coming!" he was enormously pleased by his victory over you. You were willing to concede defeat.

"So what was the big prize? What did I just narrowly miss obtaining?"

"Okay, I'll tell you but first take this" Ho-oh took some of his tokens and gave them to you. It was enough to cover all your expenses of the day and a bit more than that. You were surprised by his sudden generosity.

"Thank you!"

"Don't thank me yet because it's time for my prize. The truth is that I didn't plan so ahead. I had prepared something for when you won but I hadn't fully thought about a prize for myself" he admitted but then his face lighted up. The human representation he had created vanished in thin air, you blinked and looked around. "I got it. I know what my prize is"

"Why doesn't that fill me with comfort" you said.

"Don't worry, I won't make you do anything against your will but the least you could do would be to accept what I want to do next" he said, his voice taking the more familiar condescending tone you were familiar with. "It's fair. We competed and you lost. You won't try to get away of this, will you?"

"It would have been great if I had known what losing entailed" you argued but Ho-oh didn't care.

"Nonsense. Give me a bit of trust and just go in this tunnel"

"Okay but I'd feel more comfortable knowing what I was getting into" you sighed and entered the new path. You had the feeling you were deviating from the making amends plan Ho-oh had at the beginning of the day.

"We're going to do something I have wanted to do since a year ago: you're going to learn to respect me. You'll know all the amazing things I have done and see I'm nobody to trifle with. After this I'm sure you'll respect me and won't dare to even go against anything I say. That'll be my prize, your complete and undeniable admiration towards me!"

That was much better than you had expected. You were mildly curious, you had to admit it. You continued without saying another word but you were wondering something: Ho-oh wasn't going to let you go to his brain so watching memories was not an option. How will he show you anything?
111111111111111111111.title: Gambling with Ho-oh

1111111111111111111111.content:
As you walk in the tunnel, you imagined Ho-oh having the biggest smile on his face right now, thinking of the ways he will make you unquestionably admire him and mentally cringed at the ego-stroking that might be going through his head. You admittedly understood little about his background and wanted to know more about your host. But Ho-oh isn't making it an easy task. The way the bird put it didn't give you much assurance that his plan won't end with you in some sort of submissive position. Additionally, Ho-oh mentioned that this was an idea that he has planned since last year so it made you nervous even to think about what his original intention of respect might entail. He loved to dictate things on his terms, conditions which he could easily change in a split second. Fortunately, the Pokemon should have tamed his plan now that relations have warmed up. Should he try something naughty, the threat of more punishment from Arceus should deter that.

Ho-oh sure loves playing with me for his pleasure and loving every minute.

You finally arrived at your destination when the passage open into a large hallway with vaulted ceilings. The new surrounding gave you the impression that you entered some grand throne halls. There is only the echo of your footstep as you entered the immense chamber. The ornamentation on the ceiling and pillars are beautifully crafted with stones of all sorts colors. Their polished surface gleamed in the light given off by the walls. You walked on a long orange carpet that seems to be set out for you toward the other side. Hung upon the crystal-like walls are larger than life murals depicting Ho-oh in various settings. There are at least a dozen of those large murals in this long hall. Although you are no exactly well-versed in arts, there was a certain quality that makes them very pleasing to look at. The scene portrayed are mostly important events in Ho-oh's life and his numerous supposed achievement. The first one you laid your eyes on showed a young Ho-oh emerging from a golden egg in the midst of volcanoes and storms. Another depicts Ho-oh gliding into the sunset with a rainbow trail behind him. One notable one depicts Ho-oh glowing with a warm golden aura while surrounded by other Pokemon revering his presence. He was the former representation of the sky after all. The murals are a very propaganda-like display that reminds you of what a narcissist Ho-oh can be. Heroic, just, majestic, and benevolent.... just how the bird perceived himself.

You took your time to immerse yourself in the likely stories behind each of the scenes and thought about what to ask the Pokemon once you get the chance. But you know that it'll be mostly half-truths and a load of distortions.

At the end of the hall is a circular lobby with none other than another life-sized Ho-oh standing there with a welcoming gesture. His face is plastered with the same cryptic smile he gave you at the Game Arcade. His eyes glinted with both excitement and mischief as you approached him. You noticed the tall golden carved pillars that supported this antechamber.

"Greetings, human. Welcome to my rather magnificent hall," Ho-oh boasts in a showy tone, "It is about time for me to share with you the fact of how amazing I am."

"What exactly is this place?" you asked skeptically, "Is it another one of your illusions?"

"Well, human. You're about to find out," Ho-oh replied as he spread his wings to emphasize himself, "Since you lost the game, I want you to learn truly how great I can be and I think the best place to start is this shrine that I dedicated to myself."

"Yeah, like I need more of your tricks to know how "great and powerful" you are," you jabbed while examining the hard floor.

Ho-oh suddenly stopped and looked straight at you with a perplexed expression. For a moment, it looked like he was about to make a snarky remark but held back and composed himself at the last moment.

"Awwwww...no need to be such a cranky person," Ho-oh said with fake sadness, "We're just starting to get along so well. You're not letting my goodwill go down the drain, are you? We're friends!"

"We're not exactly there yet. Until you tell me what exactly you're doing, I'll err on the side of caution."

"Let's put it this way. I always wanted you to play a little game with me. Role play is perhaps a better word," the Pokemon said.

"Role play?" you asked with a raise eyebrow. Fear slowly crept through your mind that Ho-oh will do something bad.

"It's not the kind you think of and in no way will you be harmed," Ho-oh added, "It's a fun one that I thought up while you were one your way here. The basic outline is that I'll play an all powerful god and you'll be my loyal follower."

The word 'follower' made you wince. That doesn't sound good.

"So I get to be on the short end of the stick, again....Nice! Not much different from our current situation," you commented derisively.

"Well, human, that's where things get interesting," Ho-oh added enigmatically, "This role play would be a little different and much more exciting."

"Uh-huh..."

"Imagine me with the power of Lord Arceus and learning about all the secret I hold; doing exactly as I instructed you."

Ho-oh only looked at you, expecting your response.

"I hope you know what you're doing," you said cautiously, "I bet Arceus won't be too amused when He finds out that you're making a mockery of Him. Whether intended or not."

"Well, He's not as wrathful as your mythologies made Him to be. Arceus has some sense of humor so He'll have to deal with my little game. If not, what else can he take from me? There's a lot more important things on his plate than a powerless ex-Legendary."

"If you say so."

"Get ready, human. From this point on, you will address me as Lord Ho-oh. I'll take you on a tour through my shrine, by the end of it, you'll most definitely worship and respect me. You'll see why I'm the bringer of the rays, the holder of hope! Hahaha...come along!" Ho-oh boasted egotistically.

The Pokemon took off and led you deeper into the hall. You have a strangely curious yet scared feeling as he led you through the first set of doors.

This is where the fun begins....
1111111111111111111111.title: Ho-oh's Bragging Rights

choices: He decides to show you a place you would never imagine existed.
He decides to play a prank on you.
11111111111111111111111.content:
When Ho-oh said he had made a shrine dedicated to himself you expected around a dozen rooms and halls dedicated to himself. The lobby you just left, with the paintings and what not, you chalked it up to a very good demonstration of what the rest of the shrine would be like.

It was exactly like you thought it'd be. Opulent, full of stuff you wouldn't see anywhere else, and designed with the sole function of stroking Ho-oh's already inflated ego. It wasn't the kind of place you really wanted to be in, but you had lost the bet so there was nothing else to do other than accepting you had to deal with this session of praising your host. You just hoped it wouldn't last too long.

"How big is this shrine?" you asked. Ho-oh ignored you without subtlety, turning his head upwards in the most snotty gesture you had seen in your life "...lord Ho-oh?" you completed. Ho-oh didn't move but at least decided you had addressed him well enough.

"This shrine is so large and filled with so many marvels about me you wouldn't be done within a day. Be thankful I'm guiding you personally"

You made sure not to roll your eyes. "Thank you for your benevolence and consideration, Lord Ho-oh" As long as you didn't have to see him lying around ordering you to feed him grapes you didn't have that much of a problem with the shrine tour.

Now you decided it was a good time to see where exactly you were. It had taken a lot of willpower to not to draw your eyes towards the absolutely massive gold statue in the center of the room. It was several times bigger than the representation of Ho-oh you had to your side, you could easily rest on its head and roll around without dangers of falling down. The statue was in clear position of flying, rainbow trails of strange materials hanging from the feathers of its tail. "Well that's not very subtle" you comment, immediately receiving a glare "...Lord Ho-oh"

"Lord Ho-oh what" it seemed he wanted to hear more.

"Lord Ho-oh, bringer of the rays" you borrowed his own words from just a few minutes ago.

The speech that followed to that could be summarized in a few words: 'Ho-oh brings the sun to the world'. It was interesting and instructive in some ways, though. You sincerely listened and tried to match what he was saying to the legends and stories you had heard. While Ho-oh's speech was obviously embellished to give himself a prominent role most of the moments and scenes had some sort of equivalent in human lore. It was a bit strange, somehow, maybe because the chances of Ho-oh's bragging could have a real basis.

"How was that, human? Do you feel appropriately awed now?" he asks at the end. You give some exaggerated bows, playing the part of the worshipper almost flawlessly.

"It was truly enlightening, Lord Ho-oh, bringer of the rays"

"Bringer of the rays and what?"

Ugh. Seems like you had to add something else. You once again borrow his own words. "Lord Ho-oh, bringer of the rays and holder of hope"

"That's right. It was about time I heard such words coming from your mouth, human. Follow me!" The room branched into several adjacent hallways, each of them leading to some sort of time in Ho-oh's life. It was impossible he had done amazing stuff so often, chances were he stretched the meaning of the word 'amazing' several times. You of course didn't say that out loud while you walked through the overly decorated hall, though.

The room at the end was painted like the peak of a mountain, a model of some weird ruins were situated in a corner. "I roosted on the peak of Mt. Silver for a century. Humans wondered where I had gone and why I had taken the sun with me, and it served them right! Without my guidance crops were doomed to not to perform as well, their days were gloomy and the Pokémon were unrested until I finally decided it was time to return"

"Why did you come here, Lord Ho-oh...bringer of the rays and holder of hope?"

"And...?"

Was he serious? "And reincarnation of the sun" There. Grandiose and flowery, just like he liked it.

"That's right. I came to this mountain to meditate on what kind of favors the world desrved from me. I weighed the offerings, the work I had done for everybody, and decided what I'd do for the next thousand years"

The human tales did mention Ho-oh had been gone for long but not much had changed during that time. You didn't say that, deciding to save it for a moment you were truly pissed off. That would hurt his ego real bad. "Amazing, Lord Ho-oh. What are those ruins?"

"Humans built those ruins to commemorate my hundred years long stay on the summit of the mountain. It was a monument to the need to keep me happy and comfortable. Shame nobody learned the lesson after that because when I came back nobody made the festivals and special days I expected there to exist"

So he had always been a pampered brat. How old was he, again? A few dozen thousand years old? "And it was truly a shame" you bow again.

"You have done well so far, human. Follow me, as my shrine extends to the confines of my body"

That was new. "What do you mean?"

"This shrine's size is indescribable. To give a place to everything I have created, everything to commemorate my life, I had to create a vast net of hallways and chambers throughout my body. There's hardly a place where you wouldn't find a way into my shrine" That was no good. Surely he didn't expect you to see absolutely everything!

"Lord Ho-oh, bringer of you know all that, I don't think my measly human legs will resist such a walk. May I see the rest by my own leisure later?"

Ho-oh wasn't happy for that, the scowl in his face showed it, but he knew you had a point. "Fine! I'll accept that, but for now allow me to take some of the tokens I gave you before coming here" Well that wasn't so bad. You had a nice amount left "I do hope you learned something about my marvelous life, even if it was only two places. Do you admire me yet?"

"I must at least admit you have some amazing moments" you said and it was true. You made sure those words were as sweet and sincere as possible to appease him, and it seemed like it worked. His feathers fluffed up in pride while he pointed at a hallway. "This path here will lead you out of my shrine, where you'll be able to continue with your day. There are places yet to visit, if that's what you want"

"Wait, this shrine and the arcade don't count?"

"...fine, they do. What will you do now, then?"

"I'll go find some place to relax for now. If any of them is connected somehow to your ways to compensate me for what happened a year ago then even better, so...please tell me where to go"

Ho-oh thought for a moment. "As soon as you're out go to the right. You'll know when you arrive"

You obeyed, leaving the shrine and going where he had told you to go to. What you found was a dock and a boat, bobbling leisurely on the surface of some sort of liquid resembling water. "What's this, Ho-oh?"

Your host's voice reverberated around. "This tunnel will allow you to travel through my body while you relax. Sit or lay down and enjoy the feeling of being carried at my body's pace"

That sounded nice enough, at least you'd rest. You got on the boat, pushing it away from the dock. "So what's this, part of your circulatory system?"

"Something like that. Just because I'm a Fire type doesn't mean there isn't any water inside me, human! I think you'd know about that"

"I know more than I need to know about your bodily fluids, thank you. I'll just...rest here for a while and let me take me wherever it will go"

"You do that"

You closed your eyes, relaxing and feeling the boat glide smoothly on the surface of the water. What you didn't know was that you were on the mercy of Ho-oh. He could redirect your boat anywhere he wanted. If you had known that you wouldn't have let yourself to doze off. Ho-oh didn't seem to harbor any ill intentions, though, but he wasn't going to let a chance like this pass.
11111111111111111111111.title: The Shrine of Lord Ho-oh

111111111111111111111111.content:
You kicked back your legs let the boat carry you on toward wherever Ho-oh please. Having seen so much impossible features within this Pokemon, you are no longer surprised by the sight of this water tunnel. The thoughts of relaxing is constantly beset by the fear that Ho-oh would prank you somehow. But you tried your best to push those thought aside and focus on all the positive things that might come ahead. With your eyes closed, you listened to the sound of the stream as it rippled against your ride, gently taking you to your host's choice of destination. It's a soothing sound that recalls a previous kayaking trip at the river near you home you enjoyed with Vaporeon. Speaking of which, you wondered what Vaporeon is doing right now. You picture your favorite Pokemon lounging on that plush bed Ho-oh made for her with a satisfied expression as she slept quietly. Lucky her... I hope she is having a good time.

After a few minute's rest, you sat up and find that you are still drifting along the river. You noticed that there seems to be more piers installed along the waterway in this area as your boat went past them. The signposts you saw on the dock include "Lungs", "Foundry", "Healing Zone", "Game Corner", "Eye Chamber", "Pleasure Stimulation" and some unmarked ones. Where could those nameless tunnels lead?, you thought. Presumably, one of those could take you to the brain where you could locate the Communicator to contact Floatzel or Lugia. You badly wanted to get in touch again with your friend but it will be difficult to persuade your host to allow that. Speaking of which, how long have you been inside Ho-oh? Was it a few days or has weeks gone by? Has Lugia realized that something is wrong at this point? I have to speak with her or Floatzel as soon as it's possible. I don't want her jumping to wrong conclusions and making mistakes.

The boat eventually docked at the destination of Ho-oh's choice that looks similar to the one where you set sail. The sign here says "The Serenity Pavilion". The name has a mystifying vibe for a room and it doesn't sound like a body organ or some egotistical gimmick like the shrine. You stepped out of your boat onto the dock and entered the tunnel, fully curious about the new place. On the other side of the tunnel, you witnessed a landscape that is almost dream-like.

The first thing you noticed about the place is the warm wind and the fragrant smell of fresh grass. The dullness of Ho-oh's labyrinthine interior is replaced with a valley dotted with waves of vermilion and yellow flower that stretches as far you could see. Impressive snow-capped mountains towered over you on all sides. The huge behemoths looked purple as they rose from the mist that seems to cling to the horizon. Fogs danced around the mountain peaks while sifting through the ridges like a piece of silken scarf. A couple of feet below the ledge you're standing on is a small lake that is so wave-less that it reflected the mountains and the sky like glass. You see the sun among tufts of clouds that cast mottled shadows on the entire valley as they sailed eastward. Besides the organic tunnel you emerged from, there is no other discernible signs that this is all within Ho-oh's body.

You are so taken by the beauty of this valley. It's difficult to equate this serene and meditative place with the boisterous Ho-oh. You are tempted to find a rock, sit down, and just absorb the sight and ponder the meaning of life, things....the universe. But you decided to keep exploring the valley, following the dirt path that was cut into the ground. There has to be a reason that Ho-oh got you here.

Something about this place seems familiar to you. Was it a novel you read, a painting you've seen, a vivid dream, or your mind playing tricks on you? Isn't this called called déjà vu? The weird feeling of familiarity of a decidedly foreign situation. There is just something about this place that you can't put your finger on.

You trekked for half an hour through the meadow until you reached the foot of another hill. There is a stone stair leads up the grassy valley and into a grove of pine trees on the top. The steps looked ancient and well-worn as if countless climbers have tread upon them for centuries. It was the only thing that looks human-made in this otherwise pristine valley. You slowly walked up the stairs, curious to see what is in the forest.

At the end of the path where the trees cleared apart, you find yourself at the edge of a cliff that gave you an excellent panorama of the whole land. It is here that you truly saw the scale of the meadow you walked through. The dirt path that took you to this clearing resembles a thin thread from this vantage, disappearing into the horizon. A large pavilion sits at the center of the clearing. The white stones used to built the smooth polished pillars and dome seemed to glow in the sunlight.

You saw Ho-oh's large form in the pavilion looking out at the scenery, likely waiting for your arrival. As you made your way to the stairs leading up to the elevated floor, the bird turned around and saw you coming toward him. His wings are folded neatly to his side while his talons are perched on a thick beam of wood. Ho-oh's expression isn't the usual prideful and boastful one he likes to wear. Instead, his ruby eyes seem to radiate an uncharacteristic calm that surprises you. For the first time, you could say that Ho-oh looked thoughtful.

"Welcome, human. I'm so glad that you could join me," the bird greeted calmly.

You quietly joined Ho-oh by sitting down beside him. To your surprise, the Pokemon suddenly extended one of his multi-spectral wings and placed it to your side to shield you from the wind.

"What is this place?" you asked as you take in more of the sight around you.

"It's a place for relaxation of course," Ho-oh said, "You said that you wanted someplace to relax so I decided share with you my private meditation spot where no one besides myself have entered before. Whenever I'm feeling down or in turmoil, I always revisit this place to restore my peace of mind. It's only a small recreation of my favorite place and all of my memories."

The Pokemon finished the last sentence with a small sigh.

Sensing that there could be more to the story to decided to push a little further, "Could you tell me more, if you don't mind?"

"This valley has special meaning to me. It no longer look like this presently," Ho-oh said with a tinge of sadness, "This is Johto about 3000 years ago. It's also where I was hatched grew up, I missed this place so much."

Johto....three thousands years ago? Now you realized why the place looked so familiar. The distinctive peak of Mt. Silver can be seen in the distance amid the other mountains. The absence of Ecruteak City and the Bell Tower made the location barely recognizable. Moreover, did Ho-oh said something about growing up here?

"2000 years later, humans began to settle in this valley and built settlements," the Pokemon continued, "They've caught glimpse of me form and assumed that I was some form of sun deity and thus began their worship with me. The humans see me as a protector, a bringer of the Sun and prayed to me in shrines, asking for my "divine guidance." Over time, as more people came to this valley, the villages became towns and eventually into cities. The development changed the sight of the valley. Grasslands became roads and houses while the mountains were mined for their minerals. To the humans, they have successfully developed the land and made it prosperous. To me, I was losing a piece of my home...."

"You've been here for almost three millennia. That's an eternity for a human but likely a slow day for you. A lot must have happened since then."

"Indeed. But most of them are not very important or relevant to you," Ho-oh nonchalantly shrugged off.

"Come on Ho-oh. There has to something that you could share with me," you pleaded.

"Hmmm... what could possibly interest such a curious human?" he pondered while putting his wing to his beak.

You thought about asking Ho-oh about his rivalry with Lugia. This might be a chance for you to understand the source of their conflict.

"I have a suggestion: can you please tell me more about your time...with....Lugia?" you hesitated a little at mentioning her name.

Ho-oh looked at you and narrowed his eyes. "What do you want to know about her?" the bird asked in a firmer voice, "You know full well that I do not like you mentioning 'that' Pokemon."

"I know this is a sensitive topic for you, Ho-oh. There seemed to be some sort of frictions between you two. Why is that?"

Ho-oh briefly gritted his beak but quickly controlled himself. He lowered his head to your eye-level and focused on you.

"I'll tell you what happened..."
111111111111111111111111.title: He decides to show you a place you would never ...

1111111111111111111111111.content:
It takes you all of your willpower to not to look away when Ho-oh stares directly at your eyes. Your first instinct is to throw yourself at the stone floor of the pavilion and beg him to not to break your spine for your insolent curiosity, but you manage to resist the allure of such cowardly action. Instead you gulp and look back, seeing your reflection in his crimson eyes.

"First than all you must promise not to tell her what I'm going to say. She will think it's not important but it is" he said quite clearly. To you that sounded more like what he was going to tell you was petty or minor. You decided to wait until he actually told you before doing such hasty judgment.

"I promise"

"Fine. What do you know about our legends?"

That was an easy question. Legendary Pokemon weren't held with the same reverence people in the past had but their legends continued being an important part of any region's folklore. You knew a lot but you chose to simplify everything. "I know you two are guardians of different realms. You belong to the skies, and she belongs to the oceans. You two also lived in the towers in Ecruteak City, I think" Ho-oh nodded energetically.

"That is correct, but your legends are also greatly flawed. We didn't live in the towers, those were monuments in our honor. Mine was the Bell Tower, hers was the Brass Tower. That is very important. What happened to the towers?"

"The Bell Tower is fine and standing, but the Brass Tower is badly burned" You knew that too because while you were passing through Ecruteak you took the time to see the Burned Tower, at least from afar. You wanted to see the structure that kept strong even after the devastating events long enough. You doubted the embellished stories were completely true, though.

"When the Brass Tower burned we both were near the town. We both saw it burn and she did absolutely nothing to save it. She could have easily doused the fire off but instead she had the gall to suggest I had anything to do with that. I'm a Fire Pokemon but that doesn't mean I can do something like get rid of the fire itself. I could have tried to use my wings to extinguish the fire with wind but that would have toppled the tower. I told her all that but she continued insisting it was my fault and that I should deal with it. Before I could continue she outright left!"

That story definitely didn't paint Lugia in a favorable light. At any other moment you would have supposed this would have the usual warping of events to make Ho-oh look better than he actually did, but something in his tone convinced you he wasn't doing such thing right now. He was talking in such a passionate and angry way you doubted he was faking anything of what he was saying. The more he talked the more frustrated his body language was, his wings doing gestures of exasperation. You inched away a bit to avoid getting hit by them.

Ho-oh continued. "And because of her stubbornness three innocent Pokemon died. She left them to die!"

"Did she know they were there?" you interrupted, wanting to hold onto something that could at least make Lugia look a bit better to your eyes. Ho-oh stopped his gestures for a moment, thoughtful.

"...I don't think she knew. Does it matter?! If she had bothered to protect her tower they wouldn't have died in the first place. Of course I took responsibility of them and did my best to revive them.
