Three new legendaries were born that day and it's all because of me" The usual arrogance you had come to expect from him was back for a moment.

"Wow, that was...much worse than I was expecting" you said quietly. The thought of Lugia acting like that confused you, it didn't fit at all the image you had of her. Chances are this had happened quite some time ago. Anybody can change in hundreds and thousands of years. It was likely Lugia regretted having acted like that. In fact, you were convinced she did.

Somebody who hadn't changed from those times wouldn't have saved you when you were shrunken a year ago.

"Besides who does she think she is? She doesn't even seem to take her duties seriously! When is the last time she really was the guardian of the oceans? You met her in the forest, for crying out loud! I bet she was lazing around instead of actually doing what she's supposed to be doing" You had to admit he had a point there. Lugia had briefly gone underwater but that was only after you had escaped from Ho-oh. From all the time you knew her that was the only time you saw her anywhere in contact with the ocean.

"So that's why you two seem to dislike each other. Huh" you murmured. In a way you were glad to hear the backstory. It let you understand everything a bit better, even if it was a disappointment in terms of how Lugia behaved in the past. But now, well, Ho-oh seemed a bit more justified. "Hey, so when you encountered her a year ago, when she had me with her..."

Ho-oh looked away. "Yes, I got in the way to mess with her. I keep grudges alive, alright? And then she tells me she has a tiny human with her. I wanted to demand her to tell me just what was she thinking, hosting a human in her body, but I knew she wouldn't let you go. So I did what I thought was right"

What he thought was right was imprisoning you in his own body, apparently. That made you grit your teeth. "That was not good"

"I already apologized for that, look all that happened because of what I did. You don't have to remind me it was not good!" he shouted, glaring at you. Whooops, that hadn't been a good idea. Thankfully Ho-oh backed off.

There was silence for a moment. You decide to break it with a tentative effort to cheer him up. "You know, you may not keep grudges as well as you think. I'd be dead if that really mattered to you that much"

"You really would be dead" he agreed "That's all I have to say about Lugia. Happy now?2

"...to be honest, yeah, that was...informative" you nodded.

"Good. I'm kind of glad I told you, maybe now you won't pester me about her again. Forget about her and focus on what you, um-" he shook his head, correcting his words "What we must do. I'm not a Legendary again yet"

"Yeah, we still need to work on that. Don't worry, the moment will come. Besides I think this is progress, right? Friends talk to each other"

"Fine, it is progress" Ho-oh stood at the edge of the pavilion "I'm leaving. Go find the exit on your own. If you ever want to come back tell me and I'll guide you. Good night" and after that he flew away, leaving you alone in the pavilion.

In your opinion this didn't really make you feel better about the possibility of Lugia realizing Ho-oh had you with him. Chances were that it was going to get worse than you expected, but now you felt a sense of loyalty towards Ho-oh. You did want to help him.

What were you supposed to do, then? How to deal with Lugia? To be honest letting Ho-oh stop her if she ever came was not a satisfactory idea. There was no way that would end well.

You sat down and thought. Let's suppose you didn't manage to contact anyone and explain the situation. She could arrive in five minutes, or an hour, or a week, you didn't know. You trusted Ho-oh to at least feel if she was coming, giving you and him enough time to do something. There wouldn't be enough time to plan at that point, so you decided to do it right now.

...just in case it all went to the worst case scenario, which, knowing your luck, was what was going to happen.
1111111111111111111111111.title: Ho-oh's Story

11111111111111111111111111.content:
You sat quietly in the pavilion as the sun lowered toward the distant mountains, casting long shadows into the valley. The receding rays bathed you in a vivid orange color while the air around you cooled down as the warmth of the sun slowly dissipated. Usually, this feels like a perfect opportunity to sit back and enjoy a nice summer's evening. But your mind remained preoccupied with Ho-oh's story and the look of pure rage in his fiery eyes every time he mentioned Lugia. The venomous glare and grimaced beak still shook you deeply. You sighed and look down at the floor. What am I supposed to do?

Ho-oh's tale revealed a lot even if it's a little subjective. At least now you have something to work with, a plan could be conceived and a solution could be sought. However, any good ideas seemed elusive at the moment. The story only added to your problem by making Lugia the antagonist.

You're finding yourself increasingly seeing things the way your host did and even agreeing with him. That isn't exactly a good development if you want to be impartial on the matter but it expanded your understanding of the Pokemon you once regarded as nothing but a malicious human-hating individual.

Ho-oh is justified in being mad at Lugia. After all, it destroyed the Brass Tower and caused three other Legendaries their life and left Ho-oh to bear the brunt of cleaning up the aftermath. You were admittedly mad too at what she did in the past. But questions popped up in your head: How did the fire started in the first place? Ho-oh only said that the Tower burned when they are in town but never discussed what might have cause it. Come to think of it, you've never seen any guidebook mentioning this particular point. It was a mysterious gap in the Brass Tower's history that no one seems to be exploring.

As the story goes, Lugia demanded that Ho-oh put out the fire himself without even offering any assistance. She insinuated that Ho-oh started the fire without providing any evidence whatsoever. That just doesn't make any sense, you thought. Why would Lugia want Ho-oh to put out the fire himself? Was Lugia trying to hide something that might be in the Tower? Or worse, was there any ulterior motive on her part to pin the blame on Ho-oh?

There are countless possible reasons Lugia did what she did. No one knows for sure but herself.

Ho-oh's own account of what happened is at best incomplete, tainted by personal vendetta and colored by grudge. There are many essential pieces to this story that are missing. What were both Pokemons doing in Ecruteak City at the same time? What are the events that led up to the fire? Why was Lugia so insistent that Ho-oh take responsibility? Were humans involved in this in any ways? Is there a reason why someone would want to destroy the Brass Tower? Most importantly, what does Lugia have to say about this? What's her story?

Damn it! The more I think about a solution, the more questions are crowding out my brain. , you groaned mentally as you rubbed your temple.

By how agitated Ho-oh got during his recounting, you can tell that their mutual hatred runs deeper than he is willing to disclose. Something has been going on between these two Pokemons for a long time. The incident at the Brass Tower only served as the last straw that broke their backs. A telling clue to their rocky relations is the way Ho-oh cast himself as the more responsible Pokemon. To him, Lugia was never taking her job and responsibility seriously; someone who is undeserving of her Legendary title.

You'd hate to see what would happen if the two run into each other again. One thing for sure, it's bound to reopen old wounds and it won't be resolved by petty name calling.

"A cynical bird and an easy-going sea creature fighting each other...," you mused, "Just what I needed."

It gave you a headache just to imagine Ho-oh and Lugia's voices going back and forth inside your head like two broken records being played simultaneously.

Images of the aerial fight between Lugia and Ho-oh as they tried to settle old scores played in your mind. Both Pokemons are arguing about whose story is the true one; both are doing their best to convince you to join their side. In your imagination, when Arceus got news about this, he sent Ho-oh away to another nameless dimension together with Lugia after berating them for their actions. The idea was disturbing enough to send shivers through your spine and that's not saying what kind of fate Arceus would sentence you into.

No, I can't let that happen.

Needless to say, you wanted nothing more than to be with Lugia, who is one of your friends and the closest thing you've ever got to a girl. While Ho-oh may be an arrogant jerk sometimes, he can be quite nice if he wants to. Simply too much has happened for you to leave them the way they are.

For now, you figured that your best option is to somehow get in touch with Lugia and explain what happened to her. That is the only idea resembling a plan so far. It will would be the only way for you to make an informed decision to kick-start the process of regaining Ho-oh's lost status.
_______

You didn't noticed how long you've been absorbed by your thoughts. By the time you realized it, the sun has now completely disappeared below the horizon and stars were starting to appear on the dark sky. The air has grown frigid. You looked at the time on your Locator which now reads 9:46PM. You've spent the better part of three hours mentally ruminating over your plan. You were tired and exhausted by the long day and wanted nothing more than to lie on the soft bed in your room.

You got up and descended the mountain and traced your path through the now-dark grassland and back to the stream. The boat was still there waiting for you to climb in. Once you're safely on board, the boat set off along the stream. Along the way to your next destination, you saw more unmarked openings and docks along the way. You had expected Ho-oh to transport you back to your bed chamber for the evening. However, the single tunnel started branching into separate streams and your boat seemed to traveling into deeper sections of your host's body. You are getting a little concerned when your transport entered a narrower tunnel and started moving erratically in the rapid stream. Where could Ho-oh be taking you?

The boat took you through a dizzying maze of waterways before coming to a stop at the dock. At this point, you were nauseous and unwell from all the swaying. The moment you stepped off, the boat suddenly drifted away into the darkness beyond, stranding you at the dock.

"Hey... Ho-oh! What are you doing? Get the boat back here!" you demanded but was met with silence.

Great. Got stranded once again

The entrance before you is unmarked but appears larger and more isolated than the others as it is the only one on this particular stretch of the stream. You entered the tunnel and resigned yourself with whatever Ho-oh is going to do to you.
11111111111111111111111111.title: Creating a Plan

111111111111111111111111111.content:
You are stranded in unknown parts, there's only one path and you are almost convinced this is all something Ho-oh is trying to do to mess with you. Overall you hope this is all over soon. It is getting late, you should check on Vaporeon and then go to your room, you have no time for whatever Ho-oh has planned. Telling that to him as many times as you could shows no result, though. He doesn't even reply.

Soon you arrive to a room that is completely featureless. It doesn't seem much bigger than your own room, the problem is that you don't see a way out. The only entrance is the tunnel you came from, and you already know that leads nowhere useful. The boat is gone.

Seems you are stuck in this area. You'll have to wait for Ho-oh to let you out in the morning, since maybe he is already asleep. You pace around the room, looking for a comfortable enough spot on the flesh that makes the place. Everything is soft and kind of squishy, but somehow that doesn't make you wish to just lie anywhere. After a while you settle against the wall and prepare to sleep.

You didn't even get to close your eyes before the environment changed. "Another one of these? How many organs does this bird have that can change and show stuff like this?" you muttered. You expected this from Lugia, being partly Psychic type and all, not from Ho-oh. Maybe it was something all legendaries could do.

Everything turned black for a moment before a place resembling an shrine materialized. It didn't seem like something Ho-oh owned, mostly made of stone and without anything that could hint Ho-oh's normal ego. No statues, no carvings, no paintings, all seemed to be rather ancient and almost generic. You sat up, looking around with attention.

At some point of your watching Ho-oh - at a normal size compared to you - appeared on the altar but he wasn't alone. Besides you, there was also a figure, seemingly floating beyond the altar, just after a small platform that hung over emptiness. The Pokemon was bigger than any living being you had seen. You, at your normal size, which seemed to be your actual one during this sequence of events, would be barely bigger than his eye. You don't want to imagine how unthinkably humongous you, at your shrunken size, would be if you ever encountered him. You doubted even He would be able to see you.

It was Arceus.

Ho-oh bowed his head respectfully for a moment. Arceus spoke with a voice you didn't know how to describe, it seemed many things at once. It was impossible to be sure of a word to encompass how it sounded. "You have been forgiven"

"Thank you" Ho-oh bowed again. Unless Ho-oh had committed more transgressions that required Arceus to be aware of them you were sure this referred to your curren status as Ho-oh's prisoner...partially unwilling assistant. You couldn't really consider yourself a prisoner anymore.

"As such you will now be returned your status and your powers." Arceus announced. Ho-oh started to shine like the sun he was supposed to represent, forcing you to shield your eyes. When the shine died after a while you saw Ho-oh with a real crown and a garish cape, both of them emblazoned with way too many sun motifs. It was official, this must be some kind of dream or illusion. There was no way getting his powers back also meant receiving that stuff too. It didn't make any sense.

After parading around the shrine for a moment Ho-oh returned to Arceus. The god spoke again. "Where is the human?"

"He has been returned home and rewarded as he should be" the way Ho-oh said it sounded weird to you. There was nothing negative in his tone, which is what got you off-guard, instead he said it with pride and, somehow, a notable dose of affection. Affection towards you? It was true you and him were getting along much better than you ever did, but you don't think it would ever reach levels where the bird would talk about you with such esteem.

Arceus left without replying to that, and Ho-oh once again paraded around the shrine as if he were the most important being in the universe. This was all a strange illusion, but unlike the others Ho-oh didn't seem to be aware of your presence, even if sometimes his eyes looked towards where you were sitting not even once he made any signs of having seen you.

You started to guess this all was nothing Ho-oh intended to do, like it was subconscious and you were simply in the right place at the right time. You just hoped that, if this was something you weren't supposed to see, Ho-oh wouldn't be angry with you. It wasn't like you sneak into this place on purpose!

The environment around you vanished, and you once again found yourself in the empty and featureless organ. You waited for a few minutes, as if you expected something else to happen, but nothing changed. Guessing there was nothing else to see you once again settled on the flesh floor and looked at the watch in your locator.

5:34 AM?

"What?" Did you fall asleep at some point? You were sure you didn't, but right now you felt like you had rested for a long while. The illusion can't have lasted that long, either. What happened?

Trying to talk to Ho-oh still gave you no answers at all, it may have been too early to expect him to be awake. Since you still had nothing to do, being trapped in the organ and what not, you paced around idly, waiting patiently.

"Hello? Human?"

You heard a voice, but it wasn't around you, like Ho-oh's usually sounded. It was inside your head. Not only that, but it was also distinctly female. "Are you awake?" she said.

It didn't take long for you to figure out it was Lugia. Of course! She was part Psychic type, and hadn't she a year ago contacted you to your mind several times? You couldn't believe you had forgotten about that. You thought, enunciating the words and doing your best to keep your mind blank.

"I'm awake"

"Good! I'm sorry for talking to you so early. How are you?"

"I have been fine. Where are you?"

"I'm on my way! Remember? We are going to meet in a few hours for our usual quality time together"

You tensed. So soon? You thought you had one week more! This was no good, if Lugia linked your presence to Ho-oh this wouldn't end well at all. You had to think of something, but you also knew she would know where in the area you were, the psychic connection would guarantee that.

This was going to be a problem. You decided to keep anything related to Ho-oh hidden for now, arranging a meeting between the two legendaries would end in a disaster, but you couldn't reject the conversation and hope for the better, either.

Ho-oh could give you your normal size but you didn't want to leave him. After all, you hadn't fulfilled your task of helping him, and surely going away would undo all the friendly progress you had achieved so far. Besides, if Lugia found you she would take you away to places unknown, effectively making you lose all contact with Ho-oh.

As you saw it, your priorities were to hide everything about Ho-oh, stay with him, and somehow lie to Lugia without her suspecting anything

This was going to be a problem.
111111111111111111111111111.title: Dreaming with Ho-oh

1111111111111111111111111111.content:
Oh, this is awkward..., you thought.

You were so focused on Ho-oh's problems that you've completely forgotten about Lugia. Being away from home probably did a lot to mess with your sense of time. You can't really recalled the last time you two chat telepathically. By you estimate, it has been two months or probably more. Lugia must be very eager reconnect with you after such long period of silence. It usually was an exciting moment whenever Lugia's soft voice chimed in your mind and start off an hours-long talk. But you currently aren't as elated. How am I supposed to tell her that I'm hanging out with Ho-oh? I can't have her disrupting the progress I made with Ho-oh so far. Deep down you know that it's a matter of time before she finds out. In the meantime, you will have to find a way avoid any suspicions on Lugia's part.

"Hello? Are you still with me?" Lugia asked.

"Oh, umm... Yeah! I'm still here. Just got a little distracted by a notification on my Pokedex," you lied through your teeth.

"How's thing going for you, dear?" Lugia asked curiously, "Are you still thinking about me often?"

Hearing Lugia addressing you so affectionately made you feel guilty about the charade you are about to pull off at her. But it is necessary and the best option you have.

"Why of course, Lugia. I'm always thinking about your charming, beautiful face and voice," you thought warmly.

"Oh, you," she said playfully, "You're still as sweet as ever. So what have you been up to lately?"

"Well...let's see, where should I start? Things are going pretty awesome for me. I'm spending most of my time training and bonding with my Pokemons. Vaporeon is getting better with her moves each day. Believe it or not, I will be taking on the Elite Four in a few weeks and I really wanted to show you how far I've improved."

"Ha ha ha... That's great," Lugia complimented, "It's great to hear that things are going well for you. Nothing too out of the ordinary for you these days."

"Yep, no big turbulence for me. Life's been good," you told her without much emotion, "And what have you up to, Lugia?"

"Doing what I'm supposed to do: Patrolling my seas and its depths. Although, I must admit it gets really repetitive either watching over a featureless, vast sea with only clouds by my sides or swimming down under in pitch darkness. But I have good memories with you to keep me company, that's what keep me going. I can't wait to see you again, dear."

Hearing Lugia talking about how much she missed you really made you feel bad since you will be telling her that you are deferring your next get-together with her. You can't bear to keep up this deception. Is it really better to tell her the truth?, you wondered.

"Ummm...about that, Lugia. I'm afraid that I won't be able to make it to our get-together today," you said with a sinking feeling.

"........Huh, why? What's wrong? Did something happened?," she said worryingly but the disappointment in her voice is apparent.

"I'm so sorry, " you tried your best to keep it positive, "You see, an old friend of mine just came over about two days ago and we're planning on going on a little vacation for a week. So I must have to push back our meeting a little."

"I was so looking forward to it...," Lugia said sadly.

"I really wish this could have work out better."

"So you're going on a vacation with a friend? You aren't dating another Pokemon behind my back, are you?" Lugia asked jokingly.

"No! Of course not. I already got you, Lugia. I assure you that I have no more rooms for anyone else but you. Can't you trust me that I'm just going on a little trip with a friend?" you pouted.

"If you are going on a trip, is it alright if I tag along with another of your human friend?"

"Well, I would really love for you to come along but I don't think that would be a good idea."

"Why not?" Lugia inquired.

"He is an absolutely crazy about Legendary Pokemon, especially about you and that "other Pokemon". If he knows that I am close friends with you, he'll go absolutely nuts and start posting things about us with his computer, tearing our privacy to shred. I don't think the general population is comfortable about Pokmon-Human relations yet. And to make things worse, my friend will be pestering you and me nonstop about various personal details. Trust me, you wouldn't want to be in a position to answer questions about Pokemon reproductive rituals."

"....That.....sorta makes sense," she said awkwardly.

"I just want to keep our relations a secret and, most importantly, for your safety. You don't want Ho-oh to know that we are still together. Who knows when that guy will show up."

"No need to worry about him. I have some great news to share with you," Lugia said happily.

"What? I thought we're through with him," you tried to sound annoyed and disinterested.

"Don't be so upset, dear," Lugia assured you with smile, "Did you know that Lord Arceus has revoked Ho-oh's Legendary status pending further decision at the Legendary Summit? I got news about it from Floatzel and I couldn't believe it. Such actions were very rarely taken by Arceus, but in light of how unbecoming of a Legendary Ho-oh has become, I'd say it a fitting punishment."

"Heard anything else about him?" you asked curiously.

"I don't know the details but three-fourth of his special powers have also been removed and Arceus making him listen to lectures about humans. There was a rumor that he will be doing 'special assignments' soon. Ho-oh won't be in our way anymore."

Several weeks ago, you would've probably been cheering and celebrating this revelation with Lugia. However, after getting to know Ho-oh and armed with a better understanding of his history with Lugia, it has taken on a sadder tone.

"That's...wonderful," you feigned excitement, "He got what he deserved all along."

"Yeah. All that's missing is me getting to knock that smug smile off his beak," Lugia laughed.

You looked at the Locator and sensed that it's about time to wrap up your conversation.

"Well, I better check on my friend now, Lugia. We're almost done packing up and will be going soon."

"Alright. Stay safe, you hear. Let me know when you get to your destination, will you?"

"Heh heh, I sure will."

"Remember to keep your promise, dear," Lugia warned jocularly.

".....I'll remember that...bye."
_____

With that, Lugia's voice was gone from your mind, leaving you alone once more in the silence of the dark chamber. Your thoughts are completely occupied on what to do next. Although you successfully kept Lugia away for the time being, it felt absolutely awful to deceive her like this. You have reasons to believe that she might already be doubting your explanation about being away with a friend. I'll have to make it up to her in some ways soon.

Just then, you heard the familiar voice of your host calling for you.

"Morning. Did you have a good night, human?" Ho-oh greeted you.

"If you exclude the part where you stranded me in a remote part of your body to watch you dream, I would say I did," you replied with a groggy tone.

"So, did you enjoy the dream I showed you last night?" he asked, seemingly ignoring your complaint.

"It a bit too idealistic to say the least. I think those brightly colored cape and crown look really gaudy on you. And Arceus' character feels off and a bit too forgiving. You also conveniently wrote me out of the dream by saying I went home," you monotoned.

"Hey! I have no control over the contents of my dream. My mind creates whatever it wants," the bird growled annoyingly, "And since when did you became an expert on dreams? If you have an issue with the direction, you should bring that up with my brain or subconscious."

"Well, if I have the chance, I really want to meet the "director" about his habit of making ego-stroking stories nonstop," you said with a grin.

"Say whatever you like, human, but I'm not going to allow you to just randomly waltz into my brain and sift through it without good reasons," Ho-oh briefly said using his familiar smug tone, "Come on now, I've prepared the next boat to take you back to my Eye Chamber. There's something I want you to see."
1111111111111111111111111111.title: In Contact with Lugia

11111111111111111111111111111.content:
You'd be lying if you said having talked with Lugia was any good for you. It was true you had thought long about what you could say, and what you would do once it was time to talk with her, but now that you actually did you feel you dug a grave for yourself...hopefully metaphorically. You trusted Lugia would be able to forgive you...you had to repeat that to yourself a few times...but you fully expected this all to be much harder to get in order now.

For a moment you also wondered how Ho-oh would react if he heard about what you had told to Lugia. Would he be grateful you rejected the chance to tell Lugia about what was going on? It wasn't like you were planning to ever tell him.

When you get to the boat Ho-oh prepared for you, you were surprised to find Vaporeon sitting there, waiting for you. She jumped from the boat, running to greet you, and you scratched her behind the fins on her head. "How did you get here? Ho-oh told you to come?" Vaporeon confirmed it. Did he have something to show the both of you? The boat did take you to the Eye Chamber, so it wasn't like your host had gotten some weird idea. That was good.

When you entered the Eye Chamber you froze for a moment, remembering what you had to do the first time you were there. Cleaning his eyes hadn't been pleasant at all, and repeating the experience wasn't something you wanted. Vaporeon didn't have such qualms, immediately getting to one of the chairs that had been placed near the front. After a moment you followed her, settling onto the other. Outside, you saw the clouds and the sky. Ho-oh was flying somewhere.

"I'm here and...Vaporeon is here too. Did you call her?"

"I thought you'd like to see her. Be grateful!" Ho-oh commanded. You were grateful "I brought you here because I wanted you to know I have taken the first step"

"First step of what?"

"On getting back on my duties, of course. What else?"

Duties? Did he mean as a Legendary? That was difficult, having no powers at all. Ho-oh started descending, perching on top of a structure. Not far from there, you saw roofs, a city you recognized. It was Ecruteak. Ho-oh had finally returned to the town. You remembered the rumors about his disappearance, how it was a bad omen and all that. "Why are you here again?"

"I have been here since last night. Do you see how responsible I am? I'm here to let the town adore me"

"...'adore' is kind of the wrong word to use here" you pointed, although someone had left what seemed to be large bowls of food and some incense near where Ho-oh was resting. You supposed monks had done it.

"I know. I'm here to be the inspiration the town needs, but don't expect me to do anything further than that"

"Is that all you do when you're here. Pose around and act all high and mighty?" you weren't surprised about that, to be completely honest.

"You make me sound so selfish when you say it like that. I expected some praise out of this" That doesn't help make you look less selfish "Besides that is not all I called you here for. I want you to help me here for a while" Ho-oh went silent, unsure of how to continue. After some encouragement from you, he continued "If I'm going to try to get along better with you then I think I should get along better with the other humans in this tower. In a way you're one of them now"

"Am I?" was that good?

"You are. You spend time dealing with me and have to treat me well. The only difference between you and them is that you have way more privileges than they do" So that was what he had called you here for? To make you feel like a glorified monk? You didn't really know that the monks in the Ecruteak towers did in honor of the Legendaries, but you did know it was something very few had the privilenge to do. They even sweared secrecy regarding the Legendaries and anything related to them, stopping Trainers and most times working for free. It wasn't a career you had really been interested into, and chances were you wouldn't have even be able to turn into a monk.

"...so what?"

"So I want you to help me..."treat them better". No, I haven't been mistreating them, I never did, but maybe, just maybe, I haven't been the most pleasant Pokemon in the area. That's where you come in. Guide me, just for a few hours"

It didn't sound that difficult, and if it got Ho-oh to progress in treating people better, it meant you'd be treated better too. It was worth a try. Besides it was also a chance for you to see first-hand what was the monks' work with Ho-oh and the tower. A chance like this was likely not to repeat again.

"Sure, let's do it"
11111111111111111111111111111.title: Back in the Eye Chamber

111111111111111111111111111111.content:
"Umm..so what should I do now?"

"It's really simple, human. I want you to chaperon me for my meeting with the sacred monks, impress the townspeople of Ecruteak with my presence, and improve my damaged standing," Ho-oh answered almost gloatingly, "Consider it an honor that I gave you these tasks."

"But how am I supposed to do that then? I don't see anything in here that I could use to influence your actions. Does this mean I get to use the shocker on you every time you messed up?" you asked while grinning.

"Nope. If you are insinuating that I should allow you to assume control of me, allow me put that idea to rest," the Pokemon admonished, "However, I'm giving you some tools that can help."

That was disappointing, you thought, I thought I was going to enjoy some shock therapy; to get back at him for once.

Several tendrils emerged from your chair and formed a display in front of you while another formed a small microphone near your face.

On the display, you see meter bars indicating your host's power and various emotions. Unsurprisingly, Ho-oh’s pride is currently all over the chart no doubt because he is about to show up to the monks in his own dramatic way.

"As you might already know, my beak still lacks discipline and I can be cocky at times. Even with my significant improvements over the past weeks, there is the risk that I might have a relapse in behavior. What I want you to do is give me a little helping hand here. Whenever I feel uncertain, the display before you will show several ideas I thought of. You just have to tap on what you think is the best choice. That microphone is for you to speak with my voice if it's required. In the event you feel that I'm becoming snarky or mean, press the X icon to warn me."

“So basically, you want me to be that little voice in your head,” you said in am amused tone.

“In a way, yes. Isn't being a Legendaries' conscience for a few hours a really exciting opportunity?” Ho-oh asked.

“It’s not that it isn't good or bad for that matter. Seeing that I have very little knowledge about the rituals, I don't know if I'm able to assist you that much."

"You won't have to worry about that. I will teach you about that."

Just then, you heard a faint jingle wafting through the air. Ho-oh perked his head up toward the Tower.

“The bells... They are performing the summoning. It's time for us to make an appearance," he said as he took off..
_____

Once both of you reached the Bell Tower, there was a small group of people on the top floor waiting for the Legendary to descent. The Kimono Girls are dancing and playing with ancient instruments as the four golden bells hanging from the corners of the eave, chimed and glowed with the slow rhythm.

“Let's make this a memorable and grandoise appearance, shall we?" Ho-oh said as he circled the tower, "Think of this as my welcome-back party."

There are five figures seated in a meditative posture before an altar with more offerings. Those must be the sacred monks the Ho-oh mentioned. An older monk sat on an elevated mat and with a more ornate robe that resemble Ho-oh’s plumage. It is clear to you he is the leader of this secretive sect and he has been in this position for decades at least. Within his hands, there is a golden staff carved with old symbols and topped with a small figure of Ho-oh.

Ho-oh landed on the top of the tower before the altar which is filled with all sorts of fruits and decorations. The bird tilted up his beak and cried out, seeking the attention of all those present.

The old monk lifted his head toward Ho-oh and bowed down in reverence.

"Greetings, Lord Ho-oh, the Bringer of the Rays," he addressed your host solemnly, "It an honor to be graced with your presence once again."

"It is also an honor to be received by you again, O' Sacred Monk of Ecruteak," he spoke telepathically in a courteous tone.

"After forsaking us for so long, you have at last returned to us, Lord Ho-oh," the head monk declared, "Where art thou during your absence?"

"O' Sacred Monk, never have I forsaken the people of Ecruteak or you. My presence was requested by "The Original One" and was the reason I remained unseen for so long," Ho-oh replied as a half-truth.

"If it is "The Original One" who requested you, there is nothing we could do to interfere with His will," the monk acknowledged, "Lord Ho-oh, please do forgive me for my curiosity. Why has "The Original One" send for you?"

"These are things that I cannot answer for you, O' Sacred Monk, for He has given me instructions to not share it," the bird declined.

"Very well, then. I will not seek further answers. For now, allow my apprentices and the Kimono Girls to celebrate your return."

"Ho-oh, the Bringer of Ray, we are here perform a dance for you," the Kimono Girls recited together, "Raise your head and light our city with your Sacred Fire to commence our celebration."

The Pokemon looked down upon the other humans below him, delighted at being asked to perform his moves for them to behold. He will use Sacred Fire to light up Ecruteak in a bright arc of rainbow like he always like to do. It was his big moment to show everyone how much he has change. He even planned to request that people stop talking to him in such a stilted manner. Ho-oh smiled as he opened his mouth to release the flames to begin the celebration, which could be the beginning of his path to getting his status back.

Ho-oh expected to feel a ball of energy forming within his beak, but he felt nothing there. As quickly as his excitement came, there was a sudden realization: he didn't have enough power to perform the move. Arceus took away a majority of his power.

The Pokemon's face turned pale as he looked at the expectant humans below him. He hadn't thought about his limited power when he came back here. Ho-oh felt his stomach tying into knots and his head spinning. This is going to be awkward.

Back inside, several warnings are going off on the display, you see a brief message:

“Human, I think I just screwed up big time. I don't have the power to make the necessary impression. What should we do now?”


You looked outside the Eye Chamber and saw everyone giving Ho-oh a very confusing look. By extension, they are also looking at you which made you uncomfortable like your host is. Something has to be done before they start asking more questions.

"We'll improvise, Ho-oh!"

----
Somewhere over the skies of Johto

Lugia glided high above Olivine City, eyeing the tiny streets that snakes through its hills and the many recently-constructed buildings that dotted it's port. The city has expanded significantly over the past few years by adding more docks for cruise ships and new resorts for visitors. The development transformed the city from a mere port to a new tourist destination for humans around the world; many of them are certainly here to catch a glimpse of her. What those people didn't realized was that Lugia was gone for pretty much the last two months, out at sea. The Pokemon turned her gaze toward the horizon, to several islets just off the coast of the glistening city: Whirl Islands. Lugia sighed as she focused on the churning whirlpools that swirled between the islands she called home, recalling her conversation moments ago.

Things haven't gone as she had wanted. After being on constant duty, Lugia was so looking forward to meeting with her human again. When she established her telepathy with him, she had fully expected the human to be excited that they would soon take off on another date. But unfortunately, her timing was off. The human was on a vacation of his own with another friend and won't be back for another week. The news was saddening for her, but they had some nice telepathic conversation and the human promised to meet at a later date.

Still, Lugia didn't feel quite right about this whole thing. It took a lot more effort for her to establish a communication with the human. It felt as if he was very far off or in someplace that is resistant to psychic power. That shouldn't have happened...especially with my ability. What made Lugia especially leery is that she didn't recalled the human talking about any other friends during all their time together. From what she could tell, he didn't have many to begin with. Now that she thought about it, the human seemed a little jumpy and hesitant during their conversation.

Why would he do that?, Lugia thought fearfully. Something is going on here.

Just then, Lugia felt a presence, the summoning power of a song being played far away...from the direction of Ecruteak City. She could faintly feel the pulsing jingle of the bells on the Tower and the gentle music that calls for “him”. The familiarity of that song is very jarring for Lugia. She knew it by heart from long ago, when the two of them are on better terms; back when the Brass Tower was still standing and before the three Legendaries perished in that fire.

Ho-oh's absence hasn't gone unnoticed by the humans, as they continuously made attempts to summon him several times without results. There's no point in summoning “him” now, Lugia thought derisively, Don't they know that he has been removed by Arceus? What makes them think that it’ll work this time?

Then seconds later, her question was answered. Lugia felt it, the responding call from "him" to the summoners. No... it can't be.

Ho-oh is powerless and no longer entitled to be a Legendary. He has no more business at the Bell Tower! What is he doing there?, she thought alarmingly.

Lugia's blue eyes looked in the direction of the ancient town and frowned, I guess I have to pay our old place a visit.
111111111111111111111111111111.title: The Sacred Monks from Ecruteak

1111111111111111111111111111111.content:
You could already see a thousand ways this could go wrong. Sacred Fire was Ho-oh's signature move, therefore everyone would expect him to do it. You weren't sure what were its effects beyond burning stuff. "We can't just stand here and do nothing! Can you use any other Fire moves?"

Of course I can!

"Then we'll have to do something like that"

Everyone will know that's not what they asked for! Several options came on the screen in front of you. Half of them were related to running away, which would be quite a bad scenario. How would people take that?

"We'll see what else to do when it's time. Just do it!" You advised Ho-oh on what moves to use. He didn't have that many options, unfortunately.

Right before the head monk started approaching to check if there was anything wrong, Ho-oh used Sunny Day and then Fire Blast towards the sky. It was a far cry from using Sacred Fire, but right now what mattered was to do something, anything! The monks and the Kimono Girls stared in confusion while Ho-oh did it for several seconds. Neither Ho-oh nor you realized it, your eyesight focused towards the sky. Once the Fire Blast was done, Ho-oh looked at the head monk, who was now standing in front of the altar.

"While the power shown is unmistakably mesmerizing, Lord Ho-oh, it is not what the ceremony requires. Is everything in order?" the monk asked in a whisper.

The emotions showed Ho-oh was starting to panic, although thankfully none of that was shown outwardly. "We'll have to lie our way out of this, I guess" you said and got closer to the microphone.

"It may be possible my journey has left me quite exhausted. I'm not in condition to perform our rites" you said.

Why did you admit that?!

A look of disappointment washed over the monk's face. You looked away. "It's a half-truth! That should be good enough, right?"

"I understand" the monk replied "In that case, we shan't announce your return to the city of Ecruteak yet. Shall we continue our ceremonies?"

It seemed that, despite the lack of Sacred Fire, everyone was willing to continue the ceremony. You weren't sure if that was good or bad, but at least the head monk had accepted your excuse. That was always a good sign. Ho-oh nodded, his stress ebbing away. The head monk turned around, announcing to everyone gathered that the ceremony would continue, and although most people looked reticent, no one protested. The Kimono Girls' dance started. Watching it was certainly something interesting, the way they twirled and moved around seemed to have been created according to topics Ho-oh found pleasant. "Now what?"

I think I can continue for a bit from here

Ho-oh was required to participate in a very short event after the dance, where he lighted up several torches near the walls and incinerated a series of offerings made to bring prosperity and blessings to Ecruteak. Bowls of fruits, samples of fine objects, it all was turned into ashes that Ho-oh later scattered through the wind with his wings. All in all, the ceremony seemed to go rather well despite Ho-oh's lack of powers.

"We shall rejoice because Lord Ho-oh has returned!" the head monk proclaimed to everyone gathered. Usually that would be told to the city as a whole, but due to Ho-oh's lack of powers it was limited to only those authorized. It went unsaid secrecy was expected from all of them "He shall rest here until it's time for him to be shown to the city. For now, let us retire and finish the ceremony!"

"It went better than expected" you commented, relieved.

It did! We got lucky.

"Lord Ho-oh, please stay around until your condition has improved" the head monk requested, bowing "Our monks shall attend your needs and follow the necessary protocols, and I shall oversee them"

"Thank you for your services, O' Sacred Monk" Ho-oh replied telepathically, being led towards a room aside. Ho-oh and the monk had barely crossed the area when the winds started to pick up, having an intensity that hadn't been foreseen at all. It was obvious it wasn't a natural occurrence.

This isn't a good sign.

"What is it? Do you feel something?"

Lugia is coming.

You almost fell from your seat. How had everything gone so wrong when it seemed to be okay! But there wasn't time to despair, something needed to be done, and fast. "Do you think she'll find out I'm inside you?"

That's a possibility!

The head monk had stopped when the winds started, but after verifying it wouldn't impede the arrival to Ho-oh's temporal abode he continued leading the bird, closing the doors and leaving Ho-oh inside a rather luxurious room, where the Pokémon would be able to rest for as long as necessary. Ho-oh didn't have time to enjoy the place, though. "This isn't good! What am I supposed to do now?!" Ho-oh shouted at you once he was sure the monk was gone.

"I don't know! You tell me! Will she find out I'm here?"

"She has psychic powers! Normally they would be diminished because of my own powers, but Arceus took a good part of them away!" that explained how Lugia had managed to make contact with you. Had she sensed it was a lie or that you were inside someone else?

"Then what do you suggest we do?"

Ho-oh paced around. "If you stay inside me you could continue advising me on what to say, but you'd be at risk of being found out. You could leave my body, but then it'd be up to me to talk to her and I don't know if I can do that without causing a fight!"

"I can't leave your body, that'd be dangerous for me!" you protested, but then you looked towards where Vaporeon was sitting and watching everything. That's true, she could protect you and make sure nothing happened to you while you were outside. It wasn't required for her to eat you or anything, too.

"I know! But those are the only options I can think right now. You tell me what to do, we don't have much longer!"

So either you stayed inside Ho-oh, helped him yet risked Lugia finding out you had lied to her - you feared the consequences the both of you would have, although you knew she wouldn't hurt you - or you could leave his body temporally and trust Vaporeon to help you stay hidden somewhere in the tower, or maybe out.
1111111111111111111111111111111.title: Improvising the Ceremony

11111111111111111111111111111111.content:
"I'm not going to just go away and leave you talk with Lugia alone" you said in a tone that left no room for discussion. You knew Lugia wasn't the type to lose control over her emotions, and that she wouldn't attack Ho-oh unprovoked, but leaving him alone with her seemed risky to you. He could say something wrong, and the situation would get worse. It was a better idea to stay with him and make sure that wouldn't happen.

Ho-oh was silent for a moment before begrudgingly accepting that. "Fine. You do what you want. But whatever happens won't be my fault, I warn you"

The two of you waited for several minutes more, until the floor trembled outside. Something heavy had landed on the platform outside. It could only be Lugia. After a moment of hesitation, Ho-oh fluffed up his feathers and stepped outside, looking as arrogant as usual. You could imagine Lugia out there. "About time you got here" Ho-oh said, his voice unwavering.

Lugia wasn't in mood to beat around the bush, she was too worried about you. There was something odd about your excuse about meeting with a friend, and she feared the worst. "Have you seen the human?"

"I have seen many humans"

"You know who I'm talking about. You'd have a reason to look for him" and do much worse than just meet you, she refrained from saying "Tell me, did you ever see him?"

"I have no reason to answer anything to you"

You sucked air through your teeth. Ho-oh was starting to be a little too defensive, that'd be enough to raise suspicions. You patted the floor around you, hoping he'd feel it. "Calm down!"

"Answer me" Lugia demanded sternly.

Ho-oh took a moment to make sure he was composed before continuing. "No. I didn't see him. I don't want to see him ever again. That guy is the one who made me be like this, why'd I want to see him?"

"To take revenge on him!" Lugia approached, a bit menacing. She didn't have the patience to let him talk his way out of this "You're spiteful enough to do something like that!"

"I haven't hurt him at all!"

Lugia focused on Ho-oh, trying to find out if he was telling the truth. Being a Psychic-type Pokemon had its perks. Before Ho-oh could prepare himself, he felt a slight headache while she forced her way into his mind. It didn't take more than just a few seconds, but that was enough. "...okay, you're telling the truth. Do you at least know where he is?"

"No. I don't keep tabs on the people I hate"

"Right, of course not" Lugia sighed "I thought you'd have tried to hurt him, but you didn't do that. Maybe he was telling the truth about meeting a friend"

"You doubt what he told you?" Ho-oh didn't know what she was talking about, but anything that'd make her go away seemed like a good idea.

"It's not that I doubt it, it just feel so strange..." Lugia shook her head "I'm not going to tell you about it. I'll just try to pinpoint where he is, just to know he's okay" If the human showed to be anywhere where he had said his town was, then he was fine. If not, well, she'd get more worried. Lugia went to the edge of the tower and closed her eyes, focusing on you. Where was the human...?

It turned out he was very close to her right now. Startled, she turned around in Ho-oh's direction, and without interrupting her search, she slowly approached. Starting to feel dread, Ho-oh swallowed with nervousness but managed to keep his defiant stare towards her. "...it's strange, it feels like he was around here..." she said, approaching Ho-oh. The human had to be where Ho-oh was standing. You listened to what she said, starting to feel the same nervousness Ho-oh had. We're busted.

Ho-oh craned his neck and looked around, feigning ignorance. "I don't see him" he moved around. That was his mistake. Lugia, still trying to find the human, felt the human's presence moving. It didn't take long for her to connect the dots.

"...he's inside you"

"Uh, what? I don't know----"

"He's inside you! The human! Why's he inside you?"

"Don't ask me, I don't know!"

You lowered your face into your hands. This was going to be a problem.

"You don't know? It's your body! I doubt he could get inside you without you knowing!"

"I know nothing! Stop bothering me!"

That answer wasn't satisfactory to Lugia. It didn't take long for you to hear her voice in your head. "Where are you? You're inside Ho-oh, right? Why are you there?" You thought for a moment. Denying it wouldn't go well, so maybe if you cleared up the situation she'd understand. You and she were friends, surely she'd respect your wishes.

Besides, making friends with Ho-oh was something good, she wouldn't get in the way of that. All you had to do was explain. After preparing yourself, you answered back.
11111111111111111111111111111111.title: Stay with Ho-oh

111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
“That's enough, Lugia,” you said telepathically.

“Wha...what?! Is that you, human?” she stammered in disbelief.

“Yes, Lugia. I am currently inside Ho-oh,” you answered back.

What are you doing? Stop!, the message on the screen blared.

You got off your seat and slowly walked toward one of the “windows” to show yourself to Lugia. Her eyes widened in shock as she saw the human she love so much appear in the vermilion eyes of Ho-oh. She moved her head closer toward Ho-oh’s pupil and looked straight at you, scrutinizing every inch of your being for the slightest sign of mistreatment. Dozens of questions raced through her head at breakneck speed.

“What are you doing with this sorry excuse of a Legendary?! And just why did you lie to me about being on a vacation with a friend? You could have called me for help!,” Lugia exclaimed, her voice both concerned and upset at the same time.

“I wish that I could tell you sooner, but I wasn't able to....,” you offered weakly.

Before you could explain further, Lugia’s expression turned into a sharp glare that was clearly meant for Ho-oh. However from your vantage point, those blue eyes also pierced through you like a pair of raging maelstroms threatening to slowly drag you down to unknown depths. For all the time you spent with her, you've never seen her like this. It made you feel much worse for lying about your whereabouts.

“What are you trying to accomplish here, Ho-oh?” she demanded through clenched teeth, “What are you doing with him?”

“....I was trying to become…... friends with the human,” Ho-oh mustered enough of his courage to answer.

“You have caused more than enough problems for the Pokemon world,” she snapped.

Lugia moved menacingly toward Ho-oh until their faces were mere inches apart. You swore you could feel the hot air rushing out of her nostrils through the eye membrane.

“Release him this instance and leave!” she ordered, “Now! I'm in no mood for your games.”

“This isn't a game, Lugia,” the phoenix retorted, doing his best to keep his temper in check, “If I ever want my Legendary status restored by Lord Arceus, I have to find the human first and become friend with him.”

“Find him? More like snatched him I presume,” Lugia said coldly.

“You’re right,” Ho-oh admitted, “When I found him, the human was initially unsympathetic to my plight and told me that I deserved this punishment.”

“And rightfully so. Arceus has every right to strip you of your title and its power after what you did to my dear human. Now release him!” Lugia demanded, “I cannot possibly allow you to keep him any longer.”

“Look, I might've had a rough start by snatching him and lecturing him about my problems but I didn’t subject him to any of my old antics. I have treated him with nothing but hospitality. We have even grown to have a level of respect for one another. You can ask him if you want.”

“And how am I supposed to believe a Pokemon who has lost every last ounce of credibility?”

“If I were bent on exacting my revenge, would the human still be standing here unscathed?” Ho-oh said with thinning patience.

Lugia briefly paused for a moment before focusing her attention back toward you. She looked conflicted between wanting to believe Ho-oh’s statement and dismissing it as part of a manipulation scheme.

I guess we have to tell her everything now, the screen reads.

You took a deep breath before you explained.

“Lugia, I'm sorry that I lied to you about being with Ho-oh…. I made the wrong but necessary decision under this particular circumstance and I know that you wanted to give me a huge piece of your mind for leaving your in the dark. If I had told you the truth back then, you would've swooped in and kicked Ho-oh a new one just as he was showing me that he was willing to change.

I had serious doubts about his intentions when he first showed up raging about how I am responsible for his downfall with all the excuses he can come up with. He went on to force me down his body. At that point, I thought that he would be subjecting me to those same nasty things. But then, he started showing me around various nice places in his body and telling me about things that had happened between you and him like the incident at the Burned Tower which, according to Ho-oh, was the source of many of your differences.

I can tell that he really wanted to change for the better but didn’t know how. I guess that’s the one of the reasons Arceus asked him to be friends with me. Are you willing to give him the same benefit of doubt?”
111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Confession

1111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Needless to say, hearing Ho-oh had caught you and imprisoned you against your will did nothing to make Lugia feel any better about this. The way that sounded, it was like the phoenix was tormenting you again, just to solve his own problems and forcing you to cooperate with him. When you said you and he shared some form of respect Lugia felt a tinge of jealousy. You were the human she cherished so much, and now you were trying to be merciful towards the one Pokemon that had caused you a lot of suffering and discomfort. This isn't right, this is...almost stupid!

But she couldn't say that. If she did, she would be insulting you, and she respected you too much for that. She wanted to trust you knew what you were doing, and that if you were in trouble you'd indicate it somehow. She wanted to believe it more than anything else right now, but she couldn't, not when you were with someone she didn't trust at all. She had already left three Pokemon to die in a burning tower once, unaware they had been there, and leaving Ho-oh to solve a problem she thought he had caused. If she went away now, and something happened to you because of Ho-oh and you got hurt and died, she wouldn't ever forgive herself, especially because of how important you were for her.

She could give you the benefit of the doubt, but she couldn't extend it to Ho-oh. "No. No, I can't" she stepped back, gving Ho-oh some space "I'm not believing for a second he can treat you right"

"Of course you can't" Ho-oh muttered, exasperated.

"I'm glad you're in better terms with him, but I just don't like the thought of you being inside him, do you understand that'"

You sighed. You had hoped she'd be a bit more reasonable, but at least she wasn't lashing out. That was a good sign. "I get it, but seriously, I'm okay here! Ho-oh is pretty tolerable when he's not upset with you!"

"If you say so" she didn't sound convinced at all. She didn't want to leave you, but it wasn't like she could force you out. Trying to help you escape Ho-oh was one thing, making you leave against your will an entirely different. "I just hope you know what you're doing..."

"I have this under control" you promised. Lugia looked at you through Ho-oh's eyes, full of doubt, and shook her head before flying away. She didn't even bother saying goodbye to Ho-oh. This didn't go as badly as Ho-oh expected, but it could have gone better, too. There wasn't a big fight right now and that was what mattered.

She trust you but not me at all, you know that?

"I noticed" you said, approaching the eye membrane and carefully placing a hand on it. It was the closest you could do to patting Ho-oh's back. "Don't blame her, you haven't exactly been a saint to us"

I know that. I don't need a constant reminder of that.

What remained to be seen was what Lugia would do now. Knowing her, she wouldn't let the problem rest, especially if doing nothing could to you being in trouble. You just hoped it wouldn't be too much of a problem.

Thanks for supporting me. You know what, go over here. There's something I bet a human like you would like a passageway opened in the back of the eye.

"Where does that one go?"

There's a wind tunnel over there. Do you want to know what flying's like? Go take a look. It didn't sound bad at all! Anything that could help you relax would be nice.

..........

Lugia flew through the clouds. She had decided to stay close to Ecruteak, just in case, but that didn't seem enough. The more she thought about Ho-oh keeping the human inside him, the less she liked it. What if he had lied, if the human had been under duress? She couldn't think how he'd force the human to lie, but it was a possibility, even if it was a remote one. Upset towards Ho-oh, she decided not to fall in inaction, she decided to look for the help of someone who could help her. In times like these, it was good to be in good terms with the one Pokemon that could hold Ho-oh accountable. "Lord Arceus?" she wrote in the chat app. It took several minutes for a reply to arrive.

I hope this is urgent

Lugia explained the situation and how she felt about it, making sure not to mislead or lie. Arceus wasn't a fool, if she exaggerated anything, he'd find out in no time. Besides, telling everything like it was would allow Arceus to take better decisions. Once she was finished, she awaited Arceus' response. He's wiser than all of us, if there's someone who can make sure the human will be okay it's him.

Do you not trust the human? Is this not for the better, them to bond and be in good terms?

"He has been trapped inside Ho-oh before, he's not infallible" she hoped that was a good point.

You expect too much from me For a moment Lugia's heart sank, and then Arceus continued Allow me make this clear: I will not separate Ho-oh and the human. This is for their own good, and I hope you will accept this. However, if you are feeling unsatisfied over the current arrangement, I will try to find a measure that will allow them to continue bonding, and you to not fret about it.

"Please, anything will work!"

Ho-oh's legendary status will only be given back if he and the human bond. If Ho-oh taking care of him won't be enough, then there's another possibility I can think of. Bonding through one supporting the other through hard times is an option too.

Lugia hurried to add: "Please don't make the human have more problems in his life!"

I wouldn't think of doing that. Ho-oh is the one who needs reforming, not the human. Leave this to me, I will try to arrange something with the human. I will contact him once I have confirmed it could be done.

Nothing Lugia could do other than hoping Arceus would do the right thing. She chose to trust his decisions.
1111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Lugia's Thought

11111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
You took the stair back down to the boat and let your host take you to your next destination.

While Ho-oh gently guides the boat to the wind tunnel, you spend the time thinking repeatedly of the apprehensive look Lugia gave you before she flew away. I just hope you know what you’re doing… Her words still echoes in your mind. She obviously doubt your decision but you don’t blame her for doing so; it is understandable. If someone had asked you to put your trust in Ho-oh a few days ago, you’d probably consider them insane. After all, Lugia had known him for centuries...eons…several lifetimes over... Her opinions will be exceptionally difficult to change at this rate but it’s not impossible.

I know what I’m doing, Lugia…, you thought pensively.
_____

When the boat reached your destination, you are greeted by a large sign with flashy words complete with a caricature of Ho-oh at the entrance:

HO-OH'S FLYING EXPERIENCE
Learn to Soar through the Sky like a Legendary

You made it past the entrance and emerged in a chamber that you could only describe as a large planetarium. The domed ceiling of this structure extends more than a hundred feet high like an indoor amphitheater while being at least 80 feet across. The perimeter surrounding the chamber has a soft membrane separating you from the inner area like a protective glass barrier. You observed that the floor beyond the membrane consists of thin, elastic tendons that has been criss-crossed to form a wire mesh. When you looked past the wire mesh and deeper below, you could make out several large sphincters that are tightly closed. You recalled seeing similar wind tunnels at an amusement park but you never had the guts to try it out.

“Hi there. Looks like someone here is ready for some flying lessons,” a familiar voice called out.

You turned back and saw the humanoid Ho-oh you met back at the Game Corner dressed in a bright green flight suit that has an exaggerated amount of flight patches running all the way down his sleeves. The representation has a wide smirk as he greeted you with a big pat on the back.

“Thanks for the encouragement back there,” he said, “I could really use that sometimes... Anyways, welcome to my wind tunnel and I get to be your flight instructor today.”

The anthropomorphic Ho-oh’s smile only grew wider as he relished at the opportunity of showing you the art of flying.

“Um… Ho-oh, what’s with the costume?” you looked quizzically.

“Ah, you mean this?” Ho-oh flaunted his ensemble, “Just something to make your experience more authentic. I hear humans wear these when they try to fly. Doesn't it just look great on me?”

“...It's a bit on the gaudy side if you ask me,” you winced.

The bird looked at you with mock offense before quickly brushing it off.

“Plus, it would be easier for me to teach you in this form. Wouldn't it be unfair for some large bird to teach someone without feathers or wings, so to speak?” Ho-oh remarked self-deprecatingly.

“...I guess that makes sense in a way,” you shrugged, too flabbergasted to question him, “What do you want me to do now, Ho-oh?”

“First order of things, we'll get you a flight suit. Come along now!”

The Pokemon practically dragged you by the hand to a counter filled with various clothing and protective gears. Ho-oh browsed around and handed you a few equipment before leading you to a small stall for you to change out.

A few minutes later, after making sure that you have everything on, you presented yourself to Ho-oh outside the stall.

You are now in a bright orange suit with green and white trims made from elastic material that fits your body snugly. When you extended your arms, wing-like appendages spread out gracefully from your sleeves. Rather incredibly, there are actual feathers attached to the wire frames. It made you look like you’re wearing a passable cosplay of your host, especially with the crested head-covering and the visor which has Ho-oh’s red eyes printed on it.

“I couldn’t have done it any better,” Ho-oh clasped his hands, “You should really look at yourself, human. All equipped and ready.”

“Umm...Do you really have to put this on me?” you asked embarrassingly, pointing to the words emblazoned across your chest:

Ho-oh’s #1 Trainee

“What? It’s the truth! You’re the first human that I get to train,” the Pokemon said cockily.

“You're bragging again, Ho-oh.”

“Well, that’s my specialty, human,” Ho-oh snickered, “That one isn’t going away anytime soon, even with reformation.”
_____

Ho-oh led you past the protective barrier and into the wind tunnel proper. The soft, cushy feel of the mesh below you made it feel like walking on a trampoline.

“You see, human. Flying is all about knowing how to manipulate the wind to your favor,” the Pokemon explained, “You have to know the wind and will it to follow your directions.”

“How do I do that?” you asked.

“Explaining through words would require far more efforts than simply showing it to you. Let get started.”

"What?!"

Ho-oh snapped his fingers and made several of the large sphincters open beneath you open up. An intense gust immediately filled the room, almost knocking you out of balance.

The dome above you darkened and changed into a 360° scenery of a mountaintop.

“Now, spread your hands wide open and hold them steady,” the Pokemon instructed.

When you stretched your arms, a strong lift blew through your wings. However, you didn’t time both hands correctly, causing you to flip and fall back onto the floor with a thud.

“Ha ha, you fly like a fledgling,” Ho-oh mocked jocularly, "Let me show you how it's done."
-----

Somewhere in the crevices of space and time is the place where the Alpha Pokemon called his home: an astral hall made of aurora and celestial matters.

Within the area he designated as a personal study, Arceus looked at all of the universes on the vast expanse of ‘existence’ he has summoned before him. Countless galaxies, stars, and planets swirled as he gave each one a glance. Normally, Arceus likes to see everything that is going on within his space simultaneously. But he quietly kept his attention on one particular universe where the human and Ho-oh getting ready to fly together within the simulator. He allowed a gentle smile to sneak upon his otherwise emotionless face. After assuring Lugia about his plan for the human, Arceus slowly plans his next move, making more notes of his observations on the crystal plate in front of him using an ancient writing.

Things are coming together for the next step.You will soon see, dear Lugia...
11111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Flying Experience

111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Your host had graciously decided to give you flying lessons. You sure weren’t going to say no to that! The only experience you had with flight was when a Pokemon you used to have carried you, but this time you were going to fly without a Pokemon. It was almost anyone’s dream!

True, it was all going to be in a very safe manner in a wind tube, but it was flight nonetheless. Given the control Ho-oh had of his inner world, you were sure even if it was a wind tube it’d be quite the experience.

Ho-oh's form stepped right beside you and expertly let the wind carry him upward, he even did a flip to show how easy it was. Feeling like that was taunting you, you extended your arms like wings and let the wind carry you. The strength of the wind left you breathless, for a moment you thought you would suffocate, but with some effort you breathed through your mouth. It was a exhilarating feeling, knowing you were weightless for a few minutes, and you were so focused on these strange and awesome sensations you almost missed what Ho-oh said.

“You have to focus on your surroundings! You’re never the only one up in the air”

“But there can’t be anyone else inside you!” Unless he also started flying with you, that is.

Ho-oh sounded annoyed: “That’s not my point. Just do what I’m telling you!”

Better not to argue back, you figure. You forced yourself to stop getting lost in the sensation of the wind against you and looked around. The landscape was peaceful; it didn’t seem like there was anything in particular to watch out for. “Everything’s clear” you said.

“Are you sure?” he still seemed to be annoyed. Wondering why he was like that, you took a better look around. That’s when you saw in the distance vague shapes. Is that what he wanted you to see?

“I can’t see what’s that coming towards me” it was like a group of bird Pokemon? Given your speed and how quickly it was coming towards you, you didn’t have long to think. Dodging should be your priority.

“What do you mean you can’t-oh” he realized your eyesight wasn’t nearly as good as his. Obviously you wouldn’t be able to see it before this moment. “Quick, tilt to a side!”

You rotated in the air towards the right. It didn’t do much. The birds kept approaching at a steady pace. “It’s not working!”

Ho-oh shouted: “It has to work! Push yourself in that direction!”

You feebly tried to move like you were told. The feathers on your costume helped somewhat, but your legs were getting in the way. “This isn’t working!” you say right when the group of birds – silhouettes that didn’t even match any species you knew – enveloped you. Dodging the birds had been impossible.

Soon it was obvious that, although Ho-oh tried to make you be as similar as possible to him, there was a limit to that. From the look on his face, you judged he hadn’t considered it much before. “I’m sorry, I’m not a bird like you, Ho-oh” you said, floating in the air, the group of birds dispelled away.

“I noticed!”

“Let’s keep trying. I’m having fun even if I just failed at the very basics.” Avoiding obstacles seemed like the very first tenet of flight. You wanted to keep giving it a try, both because you liked the experience and because you wanted Ho-oh to have the satisfaction of seeing you do this right. He did like that you still wanted to learn that, even though you had failed like that and he had overlooked that. He really had thought an anthropomorphic form would help him adapt flight to the human, but doing it like a bird was just too ingrained into him.

What was supposed to be a moment focused mostly on fun turned into an ordeal when Ho-oh started taking this very seriously. Giving you instructions while you were in the air, he tried to find a way to get you to do this properly, while you followed his words attentively. Over and over the same group of birds kept coming at you, while you tried to avoid it as quickly as possible. You failed a dozen times, unable to move before the silhouettes touched you, until finally, on one attempt, you managed to move just enough for the group to pass right above you. You could have extended a hand to touch it if you wanted, for the second it passed above you.

“That was too close!” Ho-oh grumbled. “If you were flying for real, that still would have been dangerous. But it’s the best we can do. How do you feel?”

“I feel accomplished” you hadn’t been enveloped by the birds again, it was a victory as far as you were concerned.

“Good. We’ll try to get you to speed up now. Pay attention”

Learning the basics of flight was more difficult than you expected. It had a lot more positioning and details than you had thought. With surprising patience, Ho-oh gave you every instruction. With some practice you managed to be halfway competent at flying. You had gotten used to the wind and to the weightlessness, so much that, when you landed on the ground, you had to stand still for a moment so you would once again be used to the solid surface underneath you.

The illusion around you dispelled. The solid ground turned again into the springy mesh, and all around you there was the red and pink colors of flesh. Ho-oh, back into its normal form, seemed rather proud of himself. “I’m not so bad of a teacher!”

“You’re patient enough for it, at least”

“That’s not enough praise!” he complained. Amused by his shamelessness, you praised him some more, until he was satisfied. It wasn’t really forced; you were more than willing to say everything he wanted. “That's better. You know what, I should let you rest for today"

"Since when are you so concerned about my wellbeing?"

"You're lucky I have thick skin or else I'd get upset by that question" he said, pretending to be offended. "Get back to your room. I have to rest too -- and hope the monks of the tower don't come and bother me"

You stepped off the mesh, taking off the visor and crest. "Do they know what you can do with their insides?"

"I'd never tell them. Consider yourself lucky you know"

"Do other Legendaries do this stuff too?"

Ho-oh led the way. He seemed to be considering how to talk about this, but in the end, once you reached your room,he decided it was okay to tell you about other Legendaries. "Fine. I'll tell you what I know as long as you don't go around telling humans once you return home. We're supposed to be mysterious, dignified, and distant"

"Does that mean other humans have been harbored inside other Legendaries? How were their insides like?" you asked, sitting on the bed.

"I didn't say that! You're the only lucky human who's been inside Pokemon. Now if you really want to hear about other Legendaries, shut up and listen"

"Have you ever been inside someone?"

"Don't ask so many questions, you're being nosy" he bended his knees and settled on the floor, like he was going to spend the night there. Starting to feel sleepy, you got comfortable to listen. Did other Legendaries have internal wonders like Lugia and Ho-oh did? You suspected Floatzel learned to do it because of his friendship with Lugia, so it was unlikely normal Pokemon knew, right? There was a lot you were wondering about.

Pokemon's internal worlds were unprecedented. Now that you had experienced how they were like, you couldn't avoid wondering about that.
